results.description:
This group is for single, separated, divorced or widowed men and women in that wonderful 40 and over age range.

Tired of trying to wrestle past the 20 and 30 year olds whether it be with online dating or at a local happy hour or other meetup?

We are more grown up and more mature and more comfortable with ourselves and our lives. But we still like to meet new people and make new friends and have fun.

If you're interested in trying some mature activities (like happy hour, dining out, dancing, bowling, seeing a movie, etc) with other people in our age group, then come and join us.

We will have get-togethers in different places all over the Bergen, Passaic and Essex county area and maybe even in NYC.

We are all friends here. Some we already know and some we have not met yet. We want to foster a casual atmosphere around good fun and some drinks and snacks or a meal. This will be a time to relax and be yourself and unwind from the everyday world and it's pressures and demands.

NOTE:  All members MUST upload a recent picture of themselves so that meeting hosts and other members can find each other at our events.
results.name: The In Crowd - Mature Socializing for 40's, 50's,

results.description:
Hello online marketers and product owners! Meet up with fellow practitioners of Jeff Walker's Product Launch Formula.

Did you know that there is a NEW VERSION OF PLF? IT's called Product Launch Formula 4.0

Internet marketers know the legendary power of the Product Launch Formula. It's responsible for over $100 million worth of product launches in a wide range of niches. Practically every major online product launch is powered by it.

Whether you are a product owner or online marketer, no matter what market niche you are targeting, join the group and get the most out of Jeff Walker's online product launch techniques. We're looking to foster a real sense of community and help out with advice about each other's launches.

This meetup group is now managed by Devon Joseph, an experienced Product Launch formula owner. Originally founded by Hubert Lee, a Jeff Walker trained Product Launch Manager and member of Jeff Walker's exclusive Platinum coaching group. Hubert received intense personal training from Jeff Walker and his group of "Marketing Gods" (including Frank Kern and Eben Pagan). Hubert continues to receive coaching directly from Jeff Walker.

Hubert has started this Product Launch Formula meetup group with a clear sense of abundance. Under the leadership of Mr. Devon Joseph, we are looking to share knowledge and passion for online product launch management, strategy and techniques. He'll catch you up with what's been going on in the world of Jeff Walker and the Product Launch Formula.

Here's a link to catch up with what Jeff Walker is up. He has a great video of how Product Launch Formula powered the recent multi-million dollar "Big Guru Launches" :

http://www.DevonJoseph.com/plf
results.name: Product Launch Formula Meetup

results.description:
Jersey City Writers is a community of dedicated scribes who seek to develop and explore their craft by interacting with other writers. We inspire and support each other to be the best writers we can be in a fun and open social setting.


JCW meets on three days -- Sundays, Tuesdays and Thursdays. Each meeting day follows the same schedule.  Twice a month we host a Writer’s Workshop and twice a month we host a night of Writer's Prompts. (Please see schedule for details and guidelines).


All genres are welcome.  We encourage you to finish your play, your novel or your short story. Stop by and bond with other writers who understand the complicated, yet satisfying process of creating something from nothing.


If you are a local writer seeking inspiration, support and accountability…come join us!

Don't forget to check us out at http://jerseycitywriters.org/
results.name: Jersey City Writers

results.description: This group is perfect for everyone who craves better nutrition, whole foods, primary foods, spiritual foods, eating intuitively, organically, locally and seasonally, discovering foods that are best for your body type, learning when and how to do a cleanse, and much more. Warning: Joining this group may cause you to experience joyfully healthy transformations!
results.name: Staten Island Whole Health and Wellness

results.description: Find out about longboarding and skateboarding events in New York City. This meetup is a sounding board where anything skateboarding goes. Sign up to meet skaters in the New York, New Jersey, Connecticut areas... or anywhere. Meet other renegades who crave carving asphalt, itch for speed or just like to cruise through the... uhhhh... urban breeze. Beginners and all skill levels Welcome!
results.name: Longboarding New York City

results.description: The City Congregation for Humanistic Judaism provides a welcoming, diverse community for cultural and secular Jews where we can celebrate and preserve our Jewish identity. As Humanistic Jews we rely on reason, inner strength, and the support of community to face life's challenges and collectively improve the world. We welcome everyone: families, singles, unaffiliated Jews, intermarried or interfaith families, single parent families, LGBT community, atheists, and agnostics. All are welcome here. Together, we celebrate our Jewish heritage in humanistic ceremonies such as the High Holidays, Bar Mitzvahs, Bat Mitzvahs, Shabbat, and many others.
results.name: The City Congregation for Humanistic Judaism

topics.name: Music's Benefits for Children and Families
New Moms, Expecting Moms, and Young Families NYC

results.description:
This group exists for parents families who understand and celebrate the power of music in their daily lives.

Through contributing to what experts call "a rich sensory environment", music can kick start learning, and offer lifelong benefits for your child. But really this group is for anyone with children!

Programs such as the Preschool of Rock curriculum have been shown to help children develop early literacy and language skills, acquire literacy and early math skills, increase self control, and cultivate a lifelong love of music. The most important benefit, however, is the proven positive effects music has on brain development.

Anyone who loves music and loves children should join this group.
results.name: Preschool of Rock

results.description:
The purpose of the group is to introduce people to the pleasure of participating in Scottish Country dancing. The flow of the dances, the lilt of the music and the social nature of the occasion make dancing a rewarding activity in every sense. The Meetup Group will join with more experienced dancers who will provide teaching and guidance as required to enable everyone to get the most out of dancing. No experience is necessary, nor is it necessary to be from Scotland or wear a kilt. Similarly there is no need to come with a partner. The group would suit anyone looking to meet some new people, learn a new skill and enjoy an uplifting experience in a relaxed setting.


The price for an evening of dancing, including tea and cookies, is $10 and new participants get a second evening free.
results.name: The New York Scottish Country Dancing Meetup Group

results.description:
This group is for moms, dads and caregivers who want to meet other parents, babies and toddlers in the Midtown East and West neighborhood. We meet up in building playrooms, neighborhood parks, coffee spots and other venues, and also venture to other areas of the city for worthwhile child-friendly activities. All ages are welcome, as are parents who stay at home, work or whatever!

We also host exclusive events just for Midtown Moms partnering with indoor playspaces, free trial classes and boutique events. You also receive special discounts from our sponsors.

Membership is 10.00 per year (less than the cost of one drop in class for your child)

Check out our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/midtownmomsnyc
results.name: Midtown Moms of Babies, Toddlers & Preschoolers

results.who: Bring Your Dogs For A WalkABOUT

results.description:
Knit+Wine is a monthly social gathering of knitters (and crocheters) at Bar Olivino, a casual wine bar in Ft. Greene/Clinton Hill, Brooklyn. Everyone brings whatever they are working on and we sit around together and talk, work, share, help one another -- and drink wine! We meet on the last Sunday of every month, from 5-7:00 p.m.

We are a very diverse group and welcome all who want to join us (although we have had a few men come on occasion, this tends to be an all-female group). All levels are welcome, but please keep in mind that there are no lessons, so it's fine for beginners, but not best for those without any prior knowledge. There is no instruction.

Space is limited to just 20 attendees, so it is best to reserve your spot early!

Please note: There is a $2 charge to attend a MeetUp. This nominal fee was instituted to help cover the fees Meetup charges its event organizers to use their system, and also to ensure that everyone who rsvp's does indeed show up. I hope this does not deter anyone from attending.


Find us on Ravelry - just search for "Knit+Wine Brooklyn" !
results.name: Knit+Wine Brooklyn

results.description:
This meetup is in the process of being rebooted.

As New Yorkers, we want the city to stay on the cutting edge of transportation. As developers, technologists, and advocates, we are exploring the intersection of transportation, data, and innovation. Within this meetup, we are forging a positive, mutually beneficial relationship between data providers and the New York technology community.
results.name: New York Open Transportation Meetup

results.description:
IS THE DEFINITION OF TANTRA SEXUAL TECHNIQUE?

Ok, I used the word “sex.”  We, human beings, are sexual beings.  We were created from a sexual union and one of the ways that we connect with one another is through sex, but sex is just one of the ways that we connect with one another.  There are many other ways to connect with one another as well.


SO WHAT IS THE DEFINITION OF TANTRA?

If you go on line and look up the word “Tantra” you will find numerous meanings for the word.  These may range from a Spiritual Practice to Sexual Healing.


Taste of Tantra group defines Tantra as the practice of loving one’s self fully, feeling empowered in everything one does, living one’s life without judgement, restrictions, regrets and fear.  A practice of saying YES TO LIFE, living in a manner in which you can manifest positive things for yourself while discarding what no longer serves you.  We firmly believe that when you love yourself and live authentically, others will be naturally attracted to you.


Ok, this sounds easy, correct?  Well it is not quite as easy it sounds?

·  Do you know how to truly love yourself?

·  Do you recognize and approve of all of what you have accomplished?

·  Do you feel empowered?

·  Do you know how to discover your fears?

·  Do you know what the “deal breakers” in your life are?

·  Are you really satisfied in your relationships with your beloved, family and friends?


Did you answer “No” to any of the questions above?  Why is that?  Would you like to change your answers to “Yes.”?


Please join Taste of Tantra and learn how to YES TO LIFE and learn how to stop judging yourself and how to empower yourself.


Each one of our events will offer members the chance to fully explore themselves.  We will focus on defining and breaking barriers, expressing our desires and fears and living in the present.  We will emphasize the whole person in workshops including subjects such as exploring past/present relationships, movement, nutrition, intuitive writing as well as learning new ways to connect to others.  Events will vary in length from 2 hours to 4 days.  Pricing for workshops is determined by expenses incurred. 


Our events are not designed to be dating, lifestyle or hook up groups.   Unless otherwise stated, both singles and couples are invited to all events.  Unless otherwise stated, there will be no clothing optional choices in our events.


Please contact me, Pam, your organizer, at ashimoremethod@gmail.com for further information.
results.name: Taste of Tantra Metro New York

results.description:
Singles Here! Singles There! DESI Singles from Everywhere!!

If you've ever found yourself saying, “I wish I could meet some good single women/men." OR “I just want some like minded people I can hang out with." OR my favorite "I need a second family (of friends) away from my family." .... If you've ever said any one of these statements this group is for YOU! We welcome Singles, Friends, New in Town, Single Parents and Singles who have coupled up. Remember, our group is about Friendships and having Fun and along the way, who knows, when you least expect it, that Special Someone will walk onto your path ! Additionally, this group seeks to create a pleasant atmosphere in which singles can meet each other and make meaningful connections. Some of those connections are friendships, some networking and others are romantic. Whatever the connection you seek you are encouraged to explore the possibility of making all types of connections...that the best way to find true relationships! Target Demographic: South Asians (or DESI's) and anyone who is Interested in Indian Culture within age group of 21 to 49 Events will be held in the Tri-State Area (NY | NJ | CT) :-))
results.name: Desi Singles- Connecting South Asians

results.description:
Tai Chi Chuan is simultaneously a practice that enhances a healthy mind and body, and also teaches the body mechanics suitable for self-defense and for success in other sports.

David Alexander has studied for many year with William C.C. Chen since 1982, and before that with other teachers, starting in 1978. Tai Chi Chuan is suitable for all ages. When practiced it leads to greater energy and coordination and at the same time to a more peaceful state of mind.

Classes are one hour long, and include form and potentially, push-hands.  Contact us to find out what classes are available and suitable for you.

Web site: http://Internal-Tai-Chi-NY.com
results.name: Internal Tai Chi Chuan of New York

results.description:
WELCOME FAMILIES WITH KIDS WHO LIVE IN WESTERN QUEENS & Nearby (Greenpoint, Ridgewood, Midtown Manhattan,etc...)!!! Let's connect!!!

I wanted to create a group that hosts and lists many affordable activities & events, so that parents & kids can find something engaging & wonderful to occupy themselves with and get out of their homes, make friends, get fit and have fun!

Another aspect of WQKids is as a community interface where members can post various parent-related info and confer with other parents and share knowledge, so that we can all help to make our lives & raising kids in our community easier

RECOMMENDED AGE of Kids: newborn to teenager

IF YOU LIVE IN ONE OF THESE NEIGHBORHOODS OR NEARBY, PLEASE JOIN US!

Sunnyside, Woodside, Maspeth, Middle Village, Ridgewood, Jackson Heights, Hunters Point in Long Island City, and Astoria. Brooklynites welcome too! Greenpoint & Williamsburg residents, and others who live nearby!

You can also find out about Local Businesses, get offers & deals from local businesss & more.

 

IF YOU OWN A LOCAL BUSINESS OR OFFER A SERVICE, WE ARE CURRENTLY ACCEPTING SPONSORSHIP OFFERS. (Contact the Organizer for more info).

EVERYONE IS WELCOME TO SUGGEST PLAYDATES AND HOST! TELL YOUR FRIENDS ABOUT US- THE MORE THE MERRIER!

LET'S HAVE FUN TOGETHER!
results.name: WESTERN QUEENS KIDS CONNECTION (WQKids)

The members of this Meetup generally know the rules, but if you already know Skat or Schafkopf, the transition should be quite easy.

See you soon!

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to bring together local like minded serious Manhattan people who are looking to expand their social circles, make new friends, and possibly more.  Some of the events are affiliated with Weekenddating while others are and hosted by community meetup organizers .  Our events aim to foster in person connections amoung people who may have never met otherwise.    Some of the event types we offer are :Museums, bowling, pool, golf, bingo, shows, rock climbing, mingles and more. 

We are not a dating service, but rather event organizers who want to help you meet new people. 

Please feel free to call me with any questions.

Warm regards,

Jay

718-757-6933

results.description:
We are sick and tired of both political parties lying and stealing from honest, hardworking Americans. We believe that an informed vigilant citizenry is the only hope we have for defending and protecting the great American principles of individual liberty, free markets, sound money, non-interventionist foreign policy and a Constitutionally limited government.

Together we stand, divided we fall. Let us join together in the nation's most vibrant city to show our elected officials we will defend our country from tyranny. We will rally at townhalls, promote liberty, build neighborhood alliances and educate ourselves, together with others receptive to the message of liberty. Unite, or Die. Join us.
results.name: The 9/12 Project of Greater NYC

results.description:
Welcome to the NYC Wine Bar Meetup! We created this group as a way to network with other wine enthusiasts who enjoy hanging out and drinking wine at some of the city's best wine bars. At each meetup we'll pick a new wine bar to check out, and we hope that you'll join us!

While our common interest is wine, ultimately, we hope that this group will be an opportunity to meet and network with New Yorkers who would like to discuss topics beyond wine.

In keeping with the intimate atmosphere at most wine bars, we've decided to keep the group relatively small, limited to about 100 members, and focused on having a good mix of people, so unfortunately not everyone will be selected to join. We hope that our "less is more" approach will lead to better events and better networking.

Also, please only join if you see this as an opportunity to meet people who you would otherwise never have a chance to meet. If you love to rate and critique meetups, please don't join our group. On the other hand, if you'd like to make a positive contribution to the group, we'd love to meet you!
results.name: NYC Wine Bar Meetup

results.description:
Hi everybody,

Started in 1969, The Man Booker Prize is the UK's Pulitzer Prize. The Booker Prize Book Club meets once a month to read and discuss prize winners and nominees of the Man Booker Prize. All are welcome - bring your strong opinions, thoughts, and questions and let's discuss amongst ourselves!! Great way to meet new friends.

I've been in book clubs for many years, in my former city of Washington, and here. At this point my dear book friends are fun to be with and share dinner, but we don't always want to read the same things. I've had this ambition to read Booker winners for a while now, and just read a few. I'm putting this group together to have fun and enjoy some great books.

 

The group meets in restaurants or the like on the first Sunday evening of the month.

And remember..."Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx
results.name: BOOKER  PRIZE  BOOK  CLUB

results.description:
Welcome Interested Prospects!!!

Sexy Divaz Social Club is a non-profit organization established on August 27, 2009 by Lady Ju, a natural born Sexy Diva from Newark, NJ. Our club is for classy females that like to have fun, lend a helping hand to the community and enjoy time away from stress. This is not a club for females that want to compete with one another or to impress. We are a positive group of ladies that are head strong and is eager to use our time wisely.

Most women may see themselves as a “diva” ... But whats most important is if you strive to become who or what you proclaim to be.

Our primary purpose is to build a social community that brings the most classy and socially dynamic individuals together for social gatherings while achieving a balance of sophistication, community service, and fun. We participate in events that reinforce support for the youth, sick, elderly, homeless, and of course our community.

Our club logo is a depiction of what I call a “diva”. The image appears to be abstract. I chose this image because it correlates to how we define the word “diva”. The definition of a “diva is endless. Everyone has their own definition as to what a “diva” means to them. So when you see our “diva” image, it represents femininity, mystery, variety and sophistication.

Your initial meeting is a screening process which allows us to get to know a little bit about you. Not to be offensive but, Sexy Divaz SC upholds a standard... At the end of the screening, if successful, you will be voted in by the Sexy Divaz Board.

Upon acceptance in the club, there is an application fee of $25 and a 90 day probationary period. At the end of your probation, if successful, you wil become official SEXY DIVAZ and will be able to represent with your club jacket.

If you're a Sexy Diva and you know it, if you're 25yrs -and older and want to be a part of a positive sisterhood, than join us...drama must be left at the door :-)

-for more information contact: Lady Ju -  Founder/CEO    973-789-1679
                            
Chocolate - President  862-763-1228

                                         www.facebook.com/sexydivaz.sc

                                         email sexydivazsc@yahoo.com
results.name: Sexy Divaz

results.description:
The Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots was founded on April 15th, 2009. On that day over 600 disgruntled residents joined together for Nassau County’s first official Tea Parties in Hicksville and Massapequa, NY.
We are non-partisan and do not support any one political party. We will continue to support candidates from any party that shares our conservative values and views. We are active throughout New York State, and welcome new members regardless of the town you reside.

With few exceptions we hold our meetings the first Tuesday of the month at The American Legion Hall, 197 Maple Avenue Rockville Centre. Meetings run from 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM. We encourage you to attend and to bring a friend. All of our meetings are open to the public.

Mission Statement and Core Values
The impetus for the Tea Party movement is excessive government spending and taxation. Our mission is to attract, educate, organize, and mobilize our fellow citizens to secure public policy consistent with our three core values of Fiscal Responsibility, Constitutionally Limited Government and Free Markets.

Core Values:
• Fiscal Responsibility
• Constitutionally Limited Government
• Free Markets


Our Philosophy:
The Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots as an organization believes in the Fiscal Responsibility, Constitutionally Limited Government, and Free Markets. We are a non-partisan grassroots organization of individuals united by our core values derived from the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution of the United States of America and the Bill of Rights as explained in the Federalist Papers. We recognize and support the strength of grassroots organization powered by activism and civic responsibility at a local level. We hold that the United States is a republic conceived by its architects as a nation whose people were granted “unalienable rights” by our Creator. Chiefly among these are the rights to “life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness.” The Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots stand with our founders, as heirs to the republic, to claim our rights and duties which preserve their legacy and our own. We hold, as did the founders, that there exists an inherent benefit to our country when private property and prosperity are secured by natural law and the rights of the individual
results.name: ROCKVILLE  CENTRE  TEA  PARTY  PATRIOTS

results.description: Join our informal discussions of books about the mind and the brain, positive psychology and consciousness. We'll explore many daily implications of recent brain research that can help us accelerate positive change, cultivate a healthy mind and brain, and create long-lasting improvements in our lives. Some topics to explore: * How neuroplasticity enables us to rewire our brain with proper attention; * Why our brains are wired to resist change and how we can overcome that resistance; * How to apply specific brain-based strategies to develop new positive habits and increase well-being; * How to improve memory, awareness, and creativity; * How to accelerate learning and maintain vibrant and healthy brains throughout our lives.
results.name: Stamford "The Mind and The Brain" Book Club

results.description: This is a group of creative entrepreneurs in New York City. This group includes everyone: artists, designers, photographers, business owners, consultants, bloggers - anyone creating their next big idea. Learn, grow, and make meaningful connections for the future!
results.name: NYC Creative Entrepreneurs

results.description:
OneTaste New York is a community of people who know the importance of practice who gather together to have honest conversations and add the element of practice to relationship, Orgasm, and intimacy. 

OneTaste  (www.onetaste.us) is a wellness/lifestyle technology company that promotes health, vitality, and connection through the innovative wellness practice of Orgasmic Meditation. 

Our MeetUp events are open to everyone and designed to introduce you to the wide spectrum of what's possible with Orgasm, our incredible community, and Orgasmic Meditation (OM). Orgasmic Meditation (OM) is a wellness practice (like yoga and pilates) that is designed for singles and couples to experience more connection, vitality, pleasure, and meaning in every aspect of their lives. 

You can participate at whatever level feels good to you. 

We're excited to meet you! 

Warmly,

The OneTaste New York Team
results.name: OneTaste New York

results.description: An opportunity for Product Managers, Strategists,etc., to come together to meet, interact, and network. The ideal environment within which sharing and learning can flourish and complement the knowledge base for all on a peer to peer basis.
results.name: The Product Group

results.description: Learn about qigong, energy healing and Chinese Medicine.  Learn to heal yourself and others using qigong and energy healing. Over 2000 years old, Chinese Medicine is the original body, mind spirit medicine. I have been studying spirituality and healing for over 20 years. I am a Dean at the International Institute of Medical Qigong, founded by Jerry Alan Johnson. I spent 16 years at Barbara Brennan School of Healing, where for the last 7 yeasrs I held the title of  Dean of Advanced Studies.  I am also actively involved in Clairvision, founded by Dr. Samuel Sagan, an amazing school of meditation and body-centered psychology.  I have also studied  extensively with Donna Eden and Jeffrey Yuen and Bernard Shannon.  Energy healing will be the medicine of the future.  Our future health care must be preventive and oriented toward teaching people to be responsible for their own health, happiness and well-being.
results.name: New York Qigong Energy Healing

results.description:
Annette Gates, Sexologist and Creator of Natural Sexual Reprogramming (NSR)® Technique for Relationship & Sex Coaching - Offers Sessions & Workshops in: New York City & Detroit

Check out my NSR Practice Program for Men

Join me soon at a workshop!

Calendar and details at naturalsexuality.com

These workshops are for you if…

    You have a sense that certain behavior is keeping you from having the love and sex life you truly desire.

    You already enjoy your relationship, for the most part, and want it to be even better.

    You know there is much more for you to learn about having good sex and deeper intimacy with others.

A one of a kind sexuality workshop…

    The groundbreaking NSR® Technique shifts behavior that years of traditional therapy only touches.

    You receive real-time exercises that, as you practice, will make you feel an immediate effect.

    The space is safe and nurturing and opens the door for an inquiry into sex and intimacy.

What’s keeping you from…
Your truest desires in relationship? Your dream love life? Fulfilling sex?

Natural Sexuality Workshops create a safe space for inquiry and understanding sex and love in relationships. Using NSR, a gentle inquiry process, individuals learn body-based sex practices for a fulfilling internal experience of their sexuality. A re-education allows you to trade age-old beliefs around sexuality and lovemaking for a new perspective. Groups are facilitated through fully clothed cognitive inquiry processes, experiential exercises, guided visualizations, and somatic breathing techniques. Individuals are invited to participate at their own comfort level. All events are perfect for singles and couples of any orientation who are curious about deepening communication and intimacy.
results.name: Natural Sexuality - NYC

results.description: A group to discuss machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, knowledge representation, and artificial intelligence. Meetings will cover research papers and algorithms in the field. We'll also try to occasionally bring in a speaker to talk about their work.
results.name: NYC Machine Learning

results.description:
This Meetup group is no longer affiliatated with Network Plus. To find another Network Plus location: www.joinnetworkplus.com

 

Success Call to you...

 

It does, doesn’t it? I know it sounds corny but we’ve all heard success calling to us. The question is whether or not we’ve answered the call.

 

You can find all of our Success Calls meetups at our Success Calls meetup group (www.meetup.com/Success-Calls/ )We’ve re-purposed this Meetup group to be one of 4 our “Success Calls” seminar and assisted networking series.  We have 4 meetings monthly in different locations in Northern New Jersey: Elmwood Park, Fairfield, Lincoln Park and Montclair. 3 lunch time meetings and 1 happy hour (Lincoln Park)

 

Our goal is to offer you an opportunity for learning and development for yourselves or your staff at an affordable price along with the opportunity to meet and network with other like-minded individuals. Dawn Johnson, our co-facilitator will help you in this process.

 

We want to offer you “meaty” mini-seminars that you leave feeling that you have learned something new, brushed up on an existing skill or gained additional insights.

 

Whether we have 30 people or 3 in attendance, we want you to feel you have spent your time wisely.

 

These meetings are pay as you go. There are no membership fees, no obligations beyond the $15 cost to attend each meeting. (but if you could buy lunch or dinner, that’d be great – all the venues serve excellent foods and have be chosen for their diversity). Simply come to the one you’re interested. We hope you find it worth your while and come back again to which every locations suits you best, to hear which ever topic is important to you. Please tell your colleagues about us.

 

When/Where:
4 times each month – choose what’s best for you.

Cost
$15 plus your cost of any food/beverages (most meetings feature opportunities for meals under $10)
results.name: A Networking Exchange w/ Lunch AND Learning in  Montclair

results.description:
This meetup is for those interested in filmmaking. You can join no matter what your experience level is. This will be a very hands on meetup and will allow everyone to practice their craft, meet other artistic people and CREATE, CREATE, CREATE.

Whether you are an actor, production designer, grip, screenwriter, film critic, director, producer, art director, sound engineer, costume designer, production designer or cinematographer, you can join up for this group.
results.name: New York City Filmmakers

results.name: Glass Artists of Westchester County

results.description:
Discover the exciting reels and jigs and the beautiful strathspeys of Scottish Country Dancing!

You don't have to be Scottish to enjoy doing the dances from Scotland. Scottish Country Dancing is practiced on every continent (yes it even has been danced in Antarctica) and is a popular past time for people of many ages and backgrounds.

Join to stay fit, make new friends locally or to become a part of the global Scottish Country Dancing scene which offers world-wide classes and events including dance schools, weekends, formal balls, social gatherings, cruises and travel tours.

You don't need a partner, nor any experience. Our regular dancing nights are all open to beginners - so come as you are, with a pair of flat, comfortable shoes. You will join with qualified teachers and more advanced dancers to learn the footwork and formations.

The cost is $8 and you will also receive a coupon for a second night free.

results.description:
Hello my fellow social workers!!!

I'm a licensed social worker, psychotherapist, psychoanalytic candidate, and member of the Fordham University Graduate School of Social Service Alumni Advisory Board.  Over the years I worked as clinical consultant with the New York City Children’s Services and was a member of the Queens Borough President, Helen Marshall: Task Force on Domestic Violence, Child Maltreatment and Elder Abuse. 

I have consulted with numerous organizations regarding LMSW exam development and I am currently a member of Fordham Unviversity GSS Task Force for the social work licensure exam.  I teach LMSW Exam Review classes at Fordham University and other organizations.  I facilitate weekly study groups in the community for anyone who is taking the LMSW exam.   At the study groups the tutors will provide you with tips on test taking strategies for LMSW exam, share materials and practice exam questions together. 

 You will have access to tutors for assistance witha study schedule/plan, time management and reducing anxiety.

 

Starting May 23, 2010 we will be faciliating our first LCSW Study Group.

This meetup also holds meetings, continuing education trainings, peer support groups and book clubs. It could also be a time to unwind with friends for brunch and share information with each other or a time to volunteer in the community. These events will take place in the community and sometimes at home.

Many social workers who attended the study groups are passing the LMSW/LCSW exams upon completion of the study group.   

I look forward in studying and networking with you.

 

Testimonials from students who passed.

" I passed my LMSW exam! Thanks Simona, you really made the difference. Fordham University Graduate School of Social Service, Tony Filanowski, March 29, 2012.

Hi Simona,
I just wanted to tell you that I took the exam today and passed! Thank you so much for your tips, powerpoint, and practice questions. I'm so happy! I had a lot of ethics and child abuse questions! Fabiola Richard, March 12, 2012

 

I am pleased to inform you that I took and passed the New York State Licensure exam today -- and thought you'd like to hear the good news! Thanks to those who offered support and encouragement these past 2 years since earning my MSW from Fordham! Steve April 17,2012

 

Hey Simona,
I will no longer be attending the Sunday evening prep class and just wanted to thank you for allowing me to come to the prep classes again.
I passed the licensing exam this morning and I am so relieved. I took your advice and went for a massage yesterday night and did no more studying.
Please let my fellow study group folks on Sunday know that if I can pass so can they.
About my test:
-there were only about 3 or 4 questions about medication.
-I felt I had the test that ask all the what should you do first, the best , the most appropriate and what should you do next. lol you know I hate those questions.
-there were a ton of questions about ethics and professional values as well as child abuse and neglect.
Thank you so much again. I really appreciate the support and all the help.
I will be instructing my friends to take your prep class.
Yeisha,April 11, 2012
results.name: The Social Workers Study Group for LMSW/LCSW and Networking

results.description:
The goal in creating this group is to unite all paintball players from New York and New Jersey who love the sport. Having a tough time getting enough of your friends to go paintballing? Then join us! This group is meant for those who enjoy being outdoors, making new friends, playing paintball, and above all having fun. We accept players of all experience levels, so as long as you're interested, we would be thrilled to have you join our events! As a heads up, most of our players are average, casual or new players.

Our goal is to also create a community of organizers as well so we can have a consistent number of group events throughout the year without having to put the burden of organizing on the shoulders of the same few people every time. There will be times where us organizers will just want to play at events than rather organize one; in those instances other organizers can step up to the plate and carry the torch. So if you're interested in organizing an event feel free to contact any of the co-organizers of this group.

 

This group is open to new and experienced players.

Girls and Guys, 18 or older.

Younger players must be accompanied by a legal guardian.  

 

RECOMMENDATIONS FOR PREPARATION & WHAT YOU SHOULD WEAR:

* Bring a beat-up pair of boots or high-top sneakers. We will be walking/hiking through the woods for most of the day.

* Wear 2-3 layers of shirts for extra protection and a thick pair of leggings, sweats, dickie coveralls etc. I've seen people wear snowboarding pants or hockey shorts (on top of their pants) for extra protection.  I will likely have a t-shirt, long sleeve thermal plus another long sleeve military camo shirt and pants. If not you can always rent coveralls from skirmish for about $8 and wear it on top of your clothes. 

* Bring a hoodie or skullie (or both) for extra protection of your head. The rental masks provided only provide coverage of your face from slightly below your chin to slightly above your forehead.

* Bring thin gloves (baseball batting gloves are perfect) to protect your hands & knuckles.

* Bring extra money for food, upgrades and accessories. Beyond the minimum $100 you will spend on admission, bus and paintballs, as a new player, you may want to look into upgrading your gun for an additional $20 or buying gloves, neck protector or coveralls. You can also visit your local paintball shops if you wish to buy & learn about this stuff before arriving to Skirmish. You can also visit Skirmish.com or call them for pricing on these items.

* As a recommendation to the new players who are willing to make some extra investments for this trip; I would invest in a full head paintball mask which can range from $30-$50, gloves (paintball & baseball batting gloves practically the same thing) and a neck protector. It's Worth the investment in my opinion if you see yourself paintballing again in the future.

If you are a dynamic woman in the NJ area and looking for a fresh, new Women's Group, then, join us at an upcoming gathering. Sue Waldman is committed to bringing women together to exchange ideas, support aspirations, share stories & work collectively on meaningful projects. This gathering is an opportunity for Women to come together and help one another. We all have a purpose and something to give to the world.


Perhaps you have always wanted to start your own business? Maybe you want to expand the one you already own or transition to something new? Do you feel isolated and desire to have a support network? Do you need to get some respite from your business and simple have "ME" time? Our gathering may be your Answer! This group will leave you feeling inspired, connected and supported to live your life more fully.

Our group offers various opportunities for women to connect with each other, support your dreams and help one another with business, a hobby or something you want to achieve. We will network, share our stories and simply, have fun!

All groups are facilitated by Sue Waldman who is a licensed psychotherapist and Inspirational Life Coach who specializes in Women and transformation!

In 2005, Sue created the Wellness Networking Group ~ a community of professionals who serve humanity by making a difference in people's lives by spreading hope, faith and love. She conceived of the idea to promote a spirit of cooperation vs. competition in the wellness industry as a way of uniting professionals and consumers around a cooperative, supportive community dynamic. Sue will also create meet ups that sponsor her Living, Loving and Learning seminar series where outside guest speakers present inspirational classes. They are like customized adult school classes but in a more intimate setting. Two years ago, Sue Waldman started Rose Business Consulting, LLC where she helps self-employed individuals develop, market and promote their businesses.

In addition to offering private counseling and coaching sessions, Sue also hosts weekly workshops to bring the community together, to educate about wellness and lifestyle changes and to provide a peaceful place to make new friends.

Women, Networking and Wellness is all about connecting with like-minded women to learn, to share, and to discuss personal, spiritual and professional issues in a safe, sacred space to get support and empowerment from one another.

Remember ~ Each and Every day is a new Beginning and "Anything is Possible!".

For more information, contact:

The Compass Cultural Association support events in the New York area concerning the harmonious development of mankind.

The possibility of having an aim is what makes the difference between an ordinary person and those persons who has felt the urge to locate themselves, to escape from those daily prisons which constantly impoverish them without giving them direction. It is hence essential, once the goal has been identified, to determine a route and the vehicle with which to undertake the journey of harmonious development.It is necessary for people who want to live in a full and conscious way to learn how to develop new functions that make them spherical, complete, and that allow them to take advantage of every situation.


------------------- ------------------- ----------------- ------------------ -----------------
"Every man takes the limit of his own vision for the limits of the world"

Arthur Shopenhauer

"If we could know first where we are and whiter where are tending, we could better judge what to do and how to do it"

Abraham Lincoln

“Great spirits have always found violent opposition from mediocrities. The latter cannot understand it when a man does not thoughtlessly submit to hereditay prejudices, but honestly and courageously uses his intelligence “

“Insanity is doing the same thing over and over again ad expecting different results”

“Never regard your study as a duty, but as the enviable opportunity to learn to know the liberating influence of beauty in the realm of the spirit for your own personal joy and to the profit of the community to which your later work belongs”

“Try not t become a man of success, but rather to become a man of value”

ALBERT EINSTEIN

“To study history means submitting to chaos and nevertheless retaining faith
In order and meaning.
It is a very serious task , young man, and possibly a tragic one.
There’s no reality except the one contained within us.
Many people… take images outside them for reality and never allow
The world within them to assert itself.
Everything becomes a little different
As soon as it is spoken out loud.
Eternity is a mere moment, just long enough for a joke.”

HERMANN HESSE

"There is nothing good or bad in this world, if thought does not make it so."
"Our doubts are traitors and they make us lose the good that we could obtain because we are scared of trying."
"We know what we are but not what we could become"

WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE

“Ideas are not the truth; the truth is something that has to be experienced directly, from moment to moment."

JUDDU KRISHNAMURTI

"Actions are what count. Our thoughts , even if they can be good, they are false pearls until they are not turned into actions. Be the change you wish to see in the world."

MOHANDAS KARAMCHAD GANDHI

"Be faithful in small things, because it is in them that your strenght lies".

"God doesn't require us to succeed: He only requires that you try".

results.description:
NoteWorking is a New York City-based meetup for musicians and music-industry professionals using digital tools for promotion, marketing, sales and collaboration.

Every month with experts give quick presentations, full of great advice you can take home and do yourself. You'll have a chance to network with other musicians and music professionals, and there's free pizza at every meetup!

 

Our mission:

The NoteWorking mission is to service a community of aspiring and professional recording artists, producers, songwriters, musicians and other music industry professionals with Internet music business education, resources, trade, and networking opportunities in the new digital music economy.

New Media technologies have given rise to a revitalized music industry adopting D.I.Y. strategies, tools, and techniques to effectively and profitably create music compositions, productions and programming, which are marketed and distributed to music fans on a global level using a combination of free open source digital tools and low cost software technologies.

The new music economy is split now more than ever, between the music industry professional in a multi-million dollar recording facility and the bedroom producer composing in Logic or Ableton. Artists and DJs can quickly build a loyal fan base using blogging tools like Wordpress and Movable Type, live promotion using Twitter and uStream.tv, or build online music communities with social media tools like Ning, MySpace, Facebook, and Bebo. Digital-only labels now distribute with companies like Ingrooves or sell directly through Apple’s iTunes and niche indy music sites like Beatport or CDBaby. Singer/songwriters produce and edit music videos using MotionBox and then distribute with YouTube, Vimeo, and ViddYou to take advantage of a viral video opportunity that may help them to reach millions of music fans worldwide for free.

Now more than ever, community and networking combined with learning and education are critical to today’s music industry professional and hobbyist seeking guidance and advice on how to advance their music careers in a fast-paced and challenging digital world.

Through monthly ‘meetups’ and annual ‘un-conferences’, NoteWorking couples music creators with online music and media industry professional to present, explore, and discuss the relevant tools, technologies, strategies, and frameworks to build a successful music career. Each month, NoteWorking will feature experts and organizations in blogging, social media, promotion and marketing, distribution and sales, web design and development, audio and video production, law and regulation, and more.

results.description: Marital separation and divorce is painfully hard, but now that you've found us, you are not alone in this emotional, legal challenge. We are a supportive group of women who assemble to help each other navigate the incredibly painful and devastating impact of divorce. We offer a safe haven where women can talk freely, share emotions and gain understanding by empathic co-members who are or have gone through this life challenging time. Our mission is to provide women with support, resources, and information to empower you to navigate the legal process, the emotional roller coast, the financial challenges, and maybe even make friends in the process.
results.name: The Women's Divorce Support Group of NJ

results.description:
If you are the kind of person who's interests are hard to pin down because they cover just about everything, this group is for you. Like Ben Franklin's original Junto, we will have regular once-a-month meetings during which members can become acquainted with each other, discuss current events and describe their current areas of study. 

In addition to that, meetups with narrower themes can be suggested by you and if enough members express an interest, the narrower Junto can become a regular meetup, too.

Generally, all members should be interested in current events. The current core of this group has interests in libertarian politics, economics, markets, trading, and history and are personally studying topics such as physics, botany, gardening, meteorology, metaphysics, and the following languages: Italian, Spanish, and German.

results.description:
"Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine flows into trees. The winds will blow their own freshness into you, and the storms their energy, while cares will drop off like autumn leaves."
- John Muir


We are a group of hiking friends who enjoy exploring the mountains. We hike and backpack the many beautiful trails in the Northeast - the Harriman, Hudson, Kittanies, Gunks, Taconics, Catskills, Adirondacks and beyond.

We also have the passion for photography. We love taking pictures and sharing our experiences through our photos as much as we enjoy hiking the high peaks.

This meetup is primarily open to our network of hiking friends and acquaintances. One can initially join as guest of, and/or by invitation from regular members. Guest members will become full members once they have done two major day hikes with us and have shown great interest with the group, or will be taken out if inactive after a certain period.

Bear in mind that our major hikes are moderate to strenuous, with a rise of 1,000ft or more, and a total distance of at least 6miles. You must have good hiking experience or are working to promote your skills so you can enjoy our hikes and get rewarded with those amazing sights.

We believe that a more connected membership generates more goodwill and fun for all. And we would like to grow that way. We will limit the group size to promote group cohesiveness. Our core team will set the guidelines for the best way to move the group forward.

So, if you are fun, friendly and have set yourself goals to explore the mountains, then you are in. Put on your hiking shoes, grab your camera, and join us as we discover nature's beauty around us and at the high peaks!

Read more about us  http://www.meetup.com/NortheastHighPeaks/about/
results.name: Northeast High Peaks & Photography

results.description:
As a young teenager I discovered a hidden talent to read the future through the ancient practice of reading the grounds of Turkish coffee. The stories flowed out of me, and I was able to predict in great detail what would occur over the next several months. Word spread of my talent, and soon I was in high demand. Through the years I have kept up with this tradition of my ancestors and have continued to leave people amazed with the gift. I want now to share with you the mystery of reading the Turkish Coffee Grinds...

Interested in a private reading?  Send me an email indicating best days/times.  Private readings are $70 for a 30min reading or $110 for 60min.  Visit TurkishCupReading.com for more details

results.description:
The Ladies' & Gents' Uptown Coffee Hour (NYC) - a spin-off of the wildly successful Ladies' Uptown Happy Hour (NYC) - is an opportunity to drink, eat, and build community with other Uptowners. So, bring along your bestest friend, cousin, hubby, partner, wife or *maybe* (if you don't yet have one) meet someone new.........right in the neighborhood :)

With the Ladies' Uptown Happy Hour's amazing success coalescing into a fun, dynamic, and welcoming group of Ladies who segue into weekend mode at Friday Happy Hours held at fabulous Uptown venues, we decided to expand with a "co-ed" sister (or brother!) group, if you will, and thus the Coffee Hour was born!  And the results have been so much fun.  A quick peek at our group photos will show you -- our events have been a whole lot of fun..and we're keeping it going!

The Ladies' & Gents' Uptown Coffee Hour (NYC) is when we ALL meet up for brunch or tea later on in the weekend, at cool venues in and around Harlem / Morningside Heights / El Barrio / Washington Heights / Inwood / UWS. Membership is for those cousins, brothers, husbands, boyfriends, partners, best male friends, and any other nice gentlemen seeking to meet fellow Uptowners... and of course many of the original Sparkling members of thel Ladies' Uptown Happy Hour (NYC) take part too!

Let's meet, greet, solidify friendships, build community and enjoy some relaxing weekend ambiance and coffee (or mimosas??) together in Harlem and other fabulous Uptown enclaves. Coffee with cool Uptown Men and Women at interesting Uptown venues- What could be bad about that? :) Looking forward to meeting you! Check out the Sparkling Uptown Ladies who started it all, here:

http://www.meetup.com/Ladies-Uptown-Happy-Hour-NYC/

Please Note:
Members who haven't interacted with the group (or the organizer) in over a month are removed at organizer's discretion. This keeps the group fresh, active and streamlined. If this happens, please feel free to join again, any time!

results.description:
Description

We are a group comprised of young professionals who want to be physically active by playing competitive, yet fun and exciting football games. Some of us have been playing with each other for over four years and have established a great dynamic. We are looking for players who have positive attitudes, collaborate well with others and people who are laid back in the sense that their main priority is to enjoy the game and not to complain about trivial issues. If you are a carefree and upbeat player who wants to meet new and interesting people, and have some laughs in the process, you will have a great time here.

The group usually meets once a week from Nov. to April.

Cost

The membership dues is $6.00 per game for roughly 3 hours of play, which covers permits, meetup fees, equipment, organizational duties and a host of other things.  You can pay directly online when you RSVP.

Skill Level

The skill level of the group is intermediate, but all levels are welcomed.  You must be 21 years old to play.

Other Events

Being a very active person, I also organize various other events in the city so from time to time, you will receive invites to other fun sporting outings and social events :)

Be a good member!

I reserve the right to remove members who no show, or any members that do not comply with good citizenship, or any members we deem necessary for any reason.

Length of Season

We usually play from November to April and play in all conditions... rain or snow.

I look forward to playing with you...

results.description:
Welcome to Black and Latina Bi/Lesbian Professionals!

A group of fun-loving, career-minded professional friends launched Black and Latina Bi/Lesbian Professionals to provide unique, sophisticated, and fun social events for the ever-evolving taste and interest of today's bi/lesbian woman.

Social activities range from art openings, brunches, plays, movies, poetry readings, yoga, dinner parties, book clubs, after work drinks, outdoor adventures, wine tastings, group travel to DC, Philly, and Toronto, and team sports etc.

NOTE: All bi/lesbian women of color (South Asian, Asian etc) from the tri-state area (NJ, PA, CT) are welcome to join.  Because this group serves as one of the few spaces for gay and bisexual women of color, particularly feminine gay and bisexual women of color, to socialize free of the forces of racism, sexism, and homophobia, we ask that you do not apply if you are not a woman of color who identifies as a lesbian or bisexual. 

CRITERIA: As criteria for membership, all applicants must include a headshot that clearly includes their faces in their profile pictures.  Profiles with avatars, non-human subjects, cartoons, or photos that in any way, shape, or form, obscure members' faces will be rejected.  Profiles should include members' faces in order to ensure that their profiles are legitimate in order to ensure members' safety.  Profiles that do not meet this criteria will be rejected. 

Thank you for your interest and we look forward to meeting you soon.

Sincerely,
Your meetup organizers
results.name: Black and Latina Bi/Lesbian Professionals

results.description:
This is a group for fun, social NYC Physicians. If you want to network, have fun or relax this is the group for you. Doctors who would like to meet for brunch, lunch and dinner should contact each other. 

Membership

You must post a picture of yourself and answer the questions to be approved. If you have a website or office information please feel free to include it in your profile. The questions aid in allowing people to get to know you better. You might live in the same neighborhood, work in similar fields or share alumni associations. Those with children can arrange play dates. 

Answering the questions also helps to protect us from people joining who aren't physicians or who want to spam the group with information about their business/ products.  


RSVP

If you invite your friends who are physicians please add them in your rsvp.  Some venues are smaller and more intimate than others.  If an event is posted for a health fair with free dinner and an open bar if 10 of us rsvp then only the 10 of us should appear that day.  Please keep that in mind and be considerate. 

If you rsvp yes and can no longer attend an event please change your rsvp to no.  We are busy and when an emergency arises I do not expect anyone to log on to meetup and change an rsvp to no before handling the situation.  However, I always ask for a contact number if you rsvp yes and I call everyone before an event to ensure they are coming.   

Please do not rsvp yes without a contact number.  Any yes rsvp without a contact number will not be honored. 

If there is an event you will not be able to attend please rsvp no.


Advertisement 

I want everyone to feel free to participate and add anything they find to the group. If I know of any free CME, health care forum, dinners, volunteer event or expose I will post it.  I don't want this to turn into an advertising group so I am not going to post company names ... you shouldn't either.
results.name: Fun, fun, fun, fun, fun Doctors in NYC

Welcome to the NYC Metro Selenium User Group! This is a group for developers, testers, product owners and anyone who takes a deep interest in automated software testing. From curious wanderers who are just getting their feet wet to master practitioners, you’ll enjoy our meetups. We meet regularly and aim to have amazing speakers who share their experiences, insights, approaches and practices in the realm of automated software testing. It's a great opportunity to learn from the best and network with an ever growing tech community.

Automated software testing has come a long way. The tool set and the approaches have exponentially grown since the inception of Selenium. Our topics will encompass these approaches and give an insight into the tools that make them possible. Talks will feature automating testing at different levels, testing using mocks, services, functional testing, continuous integration, continuous delivery, test infrastructure and cross functional testing. We also hope to have hands-on sessions and tech panel discussions. 

Join us! 

Follow us on Twitter | FAQs

results.description:
Looking for breastfeeding information and mother-to-mother support?

La Leche League (LLL) has over 50 years of experience helping mothers to breastfeed their babies. All breastfeeding mothers, mothers-to-be, and women interested in breastfeeding are welcome to attend our free drop-in meetings or to contact our accredited volunteer Leaders for free breastfeeding information and support.

Karen 914-237-4975 home or 914-804-4337 cell
Tammie 914-664-6764
Helen 914-237-1595

Founded in 1956, LLL is an international, nonprofit, nonsectarian organization. The mission of La Leche League International (LLLI) is to help mothers worldwide to breastfeed through mother-to-mother support, encouragement, information, and education, and to promote a better understanding of breastfeeding as an important element in the healthy development of the baby and the mother. LLLI is affiliated with the World Health Organization (WHO), the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), and the U.S. Healthy Mothers, Healthy Babies Coalition. LLLI is also a founding member of the World Alliance for Breastfeeding Action (WABA).

LLL meetings provide breastfeeding information and mother-to-mother support from accredited LLL Leaders, other nursing mothers, and mothers-to-be. Meetings are open-ended discussions on mothering through breastfeeding and related aspects of birth, nutrition, and parenting.

Mothers-to-be, mothers, grandmothers, babies, and children are always welcome to attend.

LLL Leaders are experienced mothers who have breastfed their children. They are also volunteers and are accredited by LLLI to help mothers and mothers-to-be with all aspects of breastfeeding. Leaders are available to help in person at meetings, over the phone, and online.

Memberships are available for $40.00. All memberships and donations are tax-deductible. All monies support LLL, an organization that supports you!

Join our Meetup Group to learn more and to RSVP to attend upcoming meetings as soon as they are scheduled!
results.name: La Leche League Meetings in Downtown Scarsdale

We are a community dedicated to fostering ethical humanist beliefs and values and to improving the human condition through individual and collective action. We celebrate diversity and welcome newcomers of all faiths, color, sexual orientations, and nationalities - anyone who agrees with the idea that we need to help in making the world a better, more ethical place.


We have activities and events for all age groups. Among our activities are a Sunday School, a teen group, and for adults we have social gatherings, Sunday morning meetings, lectures, and discussion groups on movies, opera, and world events.

Projects of the Society include a branch of Amnesty International, the Our Times Coffeehouse, Ethical Friends of Children, whose sole purpose is to help children by providing them with needed clothing and infant furniture, and the Kenya Project - supporting the Sema Academy elementary school.

The Ethical Society Children's Ethics Program seeks to affirm the special worth of every human being and to encourage the development of those values which integrate each child into the greater human family. By identifying ethics as central to religion, children are encouraged to explore their own values and beliefs, with Ethical Culture values emphasized throughout Sunday morning lessons.

For more information visit our website at http://www.ehsli.org

We aim to educate and connect investors in a vibrant and active community. We focus on the combination of technical and fundamental analysis as used by William O'Neil and IBD. With IBDs educational support, members hone their investing skills and work to master proven buy and sell rules.
Members will maintain periodic communication via the Meetup.com website and will coordinate meeting times and locations.
We periodically host IBD speakers and receive special promotions from the publication.
We conduct review and analysis sessions - where one of the members presents a review of market actions or specific prospective or historic trade, for CANSLIM ratings and chart status, and it is discussed in the group, we cover topics such as:

1. Bases and buy rules

2. Sell rules

3. Stock charts

5. Portfolio management

Each greater NY (tri-state) member has two payment options:

a. pay for each monthly meetup separately - $25 pp (for payment - go to paypal.me/avif/25)

b. pay for a year of meetups (whether attending or not)  -ie 12 consecutive meetups -  for  $165 - that's $13.75 per meeting, whether attending or not (for payment  - go to paypal.me/avif/165)

Non NYC members, which join us in order to use the materials we put up, will be charged a flat fee of $60/year, to have free access to our presentation materials ((for payment  - go to paypal.me/avif/60) - which will be emailed to all paying members.

results.description:
This is a unique support group for people who have wish to create healthier relationships, to heal from and/or let go of a toxic or unhealthy relationship. We welcome people at all steps of their journey – whether they been to a support group, meet-up, counseling or a newcomer!

What is a toxic or unhealthy relationship?

These can be relationships you have in love, friendship, family, work, or elsewhere that are weighing you down in some capacity. You may feel stuck, misunderstood, frustrated, or not happy with where you are in your relationship.

Some questions members struggle with may include--

Do you find yourself attracting people who are unavailable, incapable of treating you with the love and respect you deserve?

Do you have difficulties making healthy choices?

Would you like to view your relationships in a new and different perspective?

This support group offers more than just "talk". Members will experience meditation, honest-open sharing, role-playing, educational readings and structured exercises within a safe, confidential and supportive environment.

Join us for a transformative experience while connecting with other members struggling with similar issues on a journey to creating fulfilling relationships, healing and/or letting go of unhealthy ones.

Group will meet 1x month on the first Sunday of the month 
7:15 PM - 8:30 PM 
at the Nanuet Pavilion Building

25 Smith Street

Nanuet, NY 10954

This group is facilitated by a Certified Addiction Recovery Coach, Certified Addiction Peer Advocate, Life Skills Coach and Independent Health Coach. Debbie brings her personal experiences of navigating through and triumphing over the difficulties of toxic relationships.
results.name: Creating Healthy Relationships in Love & Life Support Group

results.description:
A redditor is a member of www.reddit.com
If you don't know what that is, this isn't the meet-up you're looking for.

Public Mirror of the events so you don't have to sign up to meetup: http://www.reddit.com/r/nycmeetups/

We have meetups every week and other random events organized by other nerds like you!

Join our mailing list:  http://groups.google.com/group/reddit-nyc

Join the IRC Chat room!: server: chat.freenode.net  room:#/r/nyc

http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=#/r/nyc

 

This group is not a platform for you to promote your band/comedy show/circus act. You may suggest meetups for such, but do not repetitively suggest events for such if nobody comes or if you are unable to actually organize the meetup.

 

Keep in mind, when at the events, that you are in a public location and are responsible for your own safety. Look out for yourself and for your fellow Redditors. Nobody will be there to police behavior, so take it on yourself to keep a safe environment.

 

If you decide to host a meetup in a venue such as a bar or coffee shop, and you don't want to cap the meetup, you need to notify the venue for permission first. You can't just show up with 20 redditors and expect everything to work out.

 

If you have posted an event several times and continue to get no attendees, please stop spamming the group. If there is no interest, there is no interest.

 

And remember our other sister Reddit Groups!

Long Island: http://www.meetup.com/Long-Island-Redditors/
results.name: NYC Redditors

results.description:
Welcome. We are a ski club run for members by members. Our club motto is "Think Snow" - we do all the time! But just because we don't get snow year round doesn't mean we stop. Our foundation is built around snow-sports and the winter, but our club is active all year round. On season we run plenty of weekend trips to resorts in the Northeast and several week long trips out West or to Europe. Off season we don't stop- hiking, biking, happy hours, beach meet-ups and socializing are just a few of our activities. Our members are active men and women who live in the NJ/NY area. The majority of our members are in their 20's & 30's. (While we have no age limits, you do have to be 21 to join.) Whether you're a skier, snowboarder, or just like social activities, our club has something for you. Unlike some other ski clubs where you must attend every meeting, volunteer for duties, be voted in by nomination, etc...We do none of that. We realize everyone has their own lives and a busy schedule. Come to our meetings as often as you like, or as little as your schedule permits. Our $35 membership give you access to all activities year round and a great group of people. To come see what we are all about, join us at one of our weekly meetings at Willie McBrides in Hoboken, NJ.

Our Facebook group is much more active, so for our latest news go to

https://www.facebook.com/groups/17371716750/
results.name: Hoboken Ski Club

The J programming language is unlike any other.  It offers powerful tools for algorithm expression and experimentation by incorporating high-level array manipulation concepts as a logical, consistent notation. This allows you to quickly explore complex problems and express solutions succinctly.

J is a functional language but with imperative forms for flexibility.

J's concise notation and interactivity speed up algorithm development by orders of magnitude compared to more conventional languages.

Take a look at notes on our past meetings: www.jsoftware.com/jwiki/NYCJUG .

For more info on "Play" Dates, as well as a list of Works by Women qualifying shows playing in NY, opportunities for women* artists and resources for audience members and theatrical professionals, visit our website at worksbywomen.org. Become a member of Works by Women to get our weekly newsletter (It's FREE!) filled with discount codes, opportunities for women artists, advocacy articles, and the opportunity to promote the shows you are working on.

WORKS BY WOMEN supports theatrical work written, directed, and/or designed by women* by promoting their work on our website, in the press and on social media. This website serves as a tool for both theatergoers and professionals alike. We list productions that have at least a 50% female* creative team, and highlight women's theatre companies and advocacy groups. We also host a database of female playwrights, directors, and designers whose work we have seen through Works by Women. In addition, Works by Women organizes Play Dates to attend theatre productions, thus supporting with our time and money women theatre artists and the productions that hire them.

For more information: www.worksbywomen.org
Like us on Facebook.
Follow us on Twitter and Pinterest

*We use an inclusive definition of “woman” and “female” and we welcome trans and genderqueer women.

We come from all over -  Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn, Staten Island, Westchester, and New Jersey. There is also a 3 no-show and you are out of the group rule.  And lastly, when an event involves dinner or making a group reservation, there is a confirmation fee charged that will be applied to your dinner check or refunded once you show up (less the Paypal fee) or forfeited if you are a no-show.  For other large group events, a confirmation fee may be charged as well.

results.description:
Bodhisattvas are all over New York City, but you wouldn't know it even if you met one. Why? Because a bodhisattva's intention to work for the benefit of others is held hidden in his/her heart.

What is a bodhisattva? A bodhisattva is anyone who is motivated by compassion and seeks enlightenment not only for him/herself, but also for all beings everywhere.

Are you a bodhisattva who would like to meet other bodhisattvas for friendship and business networking? Allow Bodhi Lounge to fulfill your need for a spiritual community (sangha) as well as an arena to chill out, relax, make new friends, and exchange business ideas and generate spontaneous alliances of all kinds!

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome! Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our businesses!

If you can describe yourself as one or more of the following, this meetup is right for you:

• You're a Buddhist/spiritual person and want to meet other Buddhists/spiritual people for friendship and/or business networking.
• You have an interest in Buddhism and want to meet Buddhists and learn more about Buddhism in a relaxed, casual setting such as bars and other social venues.
• You're not necessarily spiritual, but would like to meet people who are.
• You want a place where you can mix spirituality with business and exploration.
• You just want to meet some cool people with open hearts and minds.

May our group be of benefit to all beings!
results.name: Bodhi Lounge | Where Bodhisattvas Chill

results.description: If you are a single woman in your late 20's, 30s or 40's then this may be the group for you! I've recently found that my single friends have slowly diminished. Though there are groups out there that focus on meeting people, I think one specific to being a single woman and getting out and meeting people locally is something that will resonate with others. While other groups are always good to meet all kinds of people in large groups, I hope to keep most events smaller and a bit more intimate allowing us to connect and develop friendships as well as meet new people! I hope to plan low key happy hours, evenings out, brunches and other activities here in Hoboken. There is no way you are going to meet anyone sitting on the couch! So join and enjoy the support and comfort of good girlfriends to help you along your journey! If you are single, new to the area, or newly single and you'd like to connect with other ladies please join! As a side note, you don't necessarily have to be single but you should have the desire to mingle, meet new girlfriends, and have a good time!
