results.description:
This group is geared to Leaders and Educators - Meetup Organizers, Teachers, Political Activists etc.

Join us in turning the "Fundamental Transformation of America" into the "Fundamental RESTORATION of America".

Why? How? Find the answers at www.TheSocietyProject.org

This group is not about protesting it is the blueprint for what we are protesting about! 

Our Mission is to:

Create a blueprint that envisions both the short and long term goals for Restoring America and presents the steps to take. 

Build awarness and faith that is IS possible to achieve the long term goal of restoring our Limited Constitutional Government as envisioned by our founders.

Facilitate other organizations with the impetus to go beyond short term changing of Politicians and mere tinkering with the current government systems.    

Elucidate the common American foundation of principles, ethics, morals and the standards on which our society was built and against which all government policies can and must be judged.

Yes we can, if we imagine the seemingly “impossible” and make a plan.   

“What the mind of man can concieve, and believe, the mind of man can achieve.”
-Napolean Hill

“Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen.”
- Ralph Waldo Emerson
results.name: Restoration of America

results.description:
If you like wine and food, this group is for you. This group was started as a place to find other people who want to learn about wine and food in a casual, fun, and stimulating setting.  This is not a dating or pick-up group.

We meet at least once per month at a local venue that allows us to bring our own wine. There are so many great places in NYC that are BYO/BYOB we can enjoy wine and food in a casual, fun, interesting, affordable atmosphere. We  have access to great wine and we are always looking to enjoy it with like minded people.

The group was founded by Vicente Pina, a wine educator, wine writer, and former retailer. He created a group that was relaxed and focused on enjoying wine without being pompous or intimidating.  When Vince left for a job opportunity in the Northwest, the members wanted to continue the group, so Dan Goroff and Jeff M, two amateur wine lovers, have taken over as organizers with support from other members.

Our aim is to promote the love of wine by providing other wine lovers the chance to learn about the wonderful world of wine and sample world-class vino as we socialize and meet a diverse group of people with similar interests. Our primary emphasis is to have fun by fusing these three activities - enjoying wine, food and meeting interesting people. The venues of our meetings will generally be BYO/BYOB places whenever possible, that also offer to great food and ambiance.

We taste wines from all over the world that have been rated by The Wine Advocate, International Wine Cellars, Wine Spectator, Wine Enthusiast magazines, James Halliday, Jancis Robinson, and other renowned experts.

Everyone is welcome! From new people to wine, to long time wine lovers. So lets join up and have fun meeting and mingling while indulging in three of life's most satisfying pleasures - PEOPLE, WINE & FOOD.

One final key point, the purpose of our events is for you, our members, to enjoy wine, food and friendship in a relaxed environment.  It is even more important that you get home safely from the event. One of the nice things about organizing wine tastings in New York is that all of our events are convenient to subway or bus lines.  After sharing six or seven bottles of wine between ten people, people should not be driving.  You can use mass transit, cabs or Uber to get home, but please do not endanger yourself or others by driving after one of our events.  We have zero tolerance for this behavior and members will be removed from the group if we find that they are driving after our events.

CHEERS!!!
results.name: NYC Wine Tasting Group

results.description:
******************************************************

ABOUT PRIVACY

If you have concerns about privacy, you do not have to join this group through MeetUp. If you are interested in the group, you can email me at melissa@myheartdances.com or call 917-689-6530 to get all of the information you need about the group.

********************************************************

This meetup group is intended to offer opportunities for women diagnosed with herpes to meet others like them. Discussion nights will be scheduled a few times a year to allow women to learn about herpes and talk about dating, relationships, stigma, and much more. Stay tuned.

If you have a suggestion for a discussion night topic, please message me: melissa@myheartdances.com

********************************************************

In Addition to this MeetUp Group

I also host a regular, private group on the 2nd & 4th Sunday of each month apart from meetup. Members of this meetup group are welcome to contact me if interested. The group is $150 every 2 months (4 sessions). There is no charge for the first meeting. Please come out and see what it is all about.

If you're interested in this group, I've pasted further details below.

********************************************************

This is not just a process group for women in the New York City area to work through the challenges presented by genital herpes infection, it is also a space for women affected by herpes to get their mind off of the infection and connect with other women on the everyday issues that we all deal with - dating, relationships, dreams about the future, health, and career.

The group is facilitated by me. I am a New York State Licensed Mental Health Counselor. Prior to becoming a psychotherapist, I was a Certified Health Coach. I have over 10 years of experience leading women's groups and coaching women who are looking for support in achieving personal goals, improving self-esteem and body image, and increasing opportunities for more satisfying relationships (dating/family/friendships). In addition, I have a special focus on working with women who have genital herpes. I know how difficult it is to find accurate information and good doctors, as well as the challenge to rebuild your self-esteem after a diagnosis. I am passionate about seeing women overcome these challenges, and the many women I have worked with over the years have discovered confidence again and have entered into great relationships.

In this group, we will sort through the facts about herpes and you will have an opportunity to get updated and accurate information about herpes. We will discuss body image, relationships, social stigmas and how all of these things uniquely affect you.

But we don't stop there. Genital herpes is only one part of your life. I have been hosting women's groups for a number of years and all women deal with challenges to their self-esteem, frustrations and disappointments in the dating world, questions about their career path, and joy in their achievements. This group will offer a structured environment with weekly topics that will provide you an opportunity to discuss these issues, process and solve the problems related, and find inspiration and motivation to move forward. Most importantly, you will be able to connect and share with other women in a safe space where you can also discuss your concerns about genital herpes.

If you have genital herpes, or your partner has genital herpes, please inquire for information about being a part of the group. The group meets on the 2nd & 4th Sunday each month. The group is $150 every 2 months. There will be no charge for the first meeting. Please come out and see what it is all about. This group is a positive, progress oriented group.

More about me:

For more information about me, please visit http://www.myheartdances.com and my blog at http://www.myheartdances.blogspot.com

To have a better understanding of how I became involved in working with women with genital herpes, please visit: http://www.myheartdances.com/p/services.html

and my story: http://myheartdances.blogspot.com/p/my-story.html
results.name: Genital Herpes is Not My Identity

results.description:
PS2G is a Local Game for Global Change based in NYC. Our mission is to restore dignity and encourage generosity through soccer.

How: 
By creating a safe, supportive and generous adult pickup soccer culture 
By helping soccer charities tell their stories and raise funds through soccer

The tendency is for unorganized pickup games to become hostile environments that breed disagreeable behavior. Our goal is to encourage positivity, safety and generosity. We are creating positive social change amongst our supporters in addition to our charity partners.

We start each game with a few words about the power of giving and encourage safe and supportive play. We cheer when nobody else is cheering. Together, we are perfecting the art of pickup soccer by creating generous environments where all good things can flourish

So far we have: 
Raised funds and awareness for 10 charities 
Organized 1,300 fundraising pickup games 
Granted $22,848 since 2010 from local pickup games ($10,000 in 2014 alone) 
Encouraged generosity to 2,300 adult players 
Trained 40 community game leaders 
Directed 2 “soccer for social good” documentaries

You can lead a fundraising pickup game or sign up to an existing one.

Games are low cost!

Leaders play for free!

Big Goals When Possible!

Friendliest Games (Ask Anyone)!!

 

All of the proceeds support our charity partners ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for children in need.

Nelson Mandela said, “Sport has the power to change the world…It speaks to youth in a language they understand. Sport can create hope where once there was only despair.” PS2G aims to support financially and raise the awareness of soccer charities that are positively affecting the lives of children and acting as catalysts for social change.

Check out our website:

www.playsoccer2give.com

PS2G is a nonprofit successfully operating since 2010 with 501(c)(3) tax exempt status.
results.name: PS2G NYC-Coed Soccer Pickup for Charity -Play Soccer 2 Give

results.description:
We meet at the Sony Plaza at 550 Madison (between 55th and 56th) every first Saturday of the month at 2pm, and at Bread and Butter (29th and Park) every third Wednesday at 7pm.

We talk about why our best logic, experience, physics, (yes, even quantum mechanics) psychology and neuroscience all point to the inescapable conclusion that human beings DO NOT have a free will; we have a predetermined, causal will.

Download a free pdf copy of my bookFree Will: Its Refutation, Societal Cost and Role in Climate Change Denial here - http://files.meetup.com/1626947/fw.pdf

What makes free will impossible?  Logically, because everything happens for a reason, and every reason has a prior reason.  Experientially, the simple fact that we cannot think, feel or do whatever we want, whenever we want.  In physics, both causality and randomness.  In psychology, an unconscious that never sleeps.  In neuroscience, Libet's experiments (see our About page).

Believing in free will hurts us more than it helps us.  Philosophers and psychologists like Derk Pereboom and John Bargh are seeing the advantages of our evolving to a consciousness that considers free will no more real than a flat Earth.  As we move beyond the illusion that humans can act freely of what makes us who we are, like our heredity and environment, we can create a more intelligent and compassionate world.

Although the group's official position is that we have predetermined wills, we welcome those who aren't  sure, and those who believe in free will.

At our Meetups, those of us who understand the predetermined nature of our feelings, thoughts and acts explore how using this knowledge every day can make our lives smarter and more pleasant. Those of us who believe our choices are completely “free” of determining influences like past experiences, heredity and the unconscious discover why our best science, logic and experience make such a will impossible.

Because religious arguments are belief-based, we limit our discussion to what empirical evidence, reason, and personal experience tell us about human will.

Our three rules are that we refrain from advancing belief-based evidence, we remain civil and respectful of each other, and that we have an great time exploring this truly awesome topic.  The last rule is very important.

Because our topic is fundamental to who we are as human beings, and so unexplored by most of us, members should find our conversations enlightening and refreshing.  If you enjoy meeting like-minded people, and stretching your brain to discover how our will really works, you'll have a great time at our Meetups.

How to disprove ANY free will argument in 2 easy steps

1.  Ask the free will believer to give an example of a choice they consider to be freely willed.

2.  Ask the free will believer to say whether or not that choice was caused.

Congratulations; you’ve won!

If the free will believer says the choice was caused, the causal regression makes free will impossible.

If the free will believer says the choice was uncaused, that would mean the choice was random.  Clearly a random thought is not what we mean when we say we believe a thought is freely willed.

You can easily apply this two-step refutation to any, and all, free will arguments. 

 

For a more in-debth understanding of the topic, read the About page.
results.name: Exploring the Illusion of Free Will

results.description:
The Moms Groups are facilitated chats hosted in 23 locations a week since 2008 by Renee Sullivan, parent and lifestyle coach, or Julia, Jordana, or Kerry - group facilitators and fellow moms.

Welcome! The Moms Groups are excited to be beginning our eighth year and have connected 5,200 women in our groups since our launch in 2008 providing fun, resources and support from Pregnancy to New Moms Groups to playgroups, to moms night out - join us! 

We host our Moms Groups in Flatiron, Chelsea, Gramercy, UES, UWS, Murray Hill, Union Square, Midtown East, Midtown West, Kips Bay, Upper East Side, Upper West Side , Carroll Gardens, Cobble Hill, Brooklyn Heights, and Williamsburg. 

We chat about all things baby and pregnancy, from finding a pediatrician, to finding a nanny in NYC, daycares, babysitters, part time nannies, to newborn sleep and schedules, to baby gear, returning to work, maternity leave, staying at home, music classes, yoga classes, and other fun things to do in NYC and everything in between!


Our May / June 2016 Calendar of Events may be found inside.


The Moms Groups are an engaging and lively community where women come together to support, learn, and socialize in a friendly and social baby friendly environment. We have grown to be the largest organization in the country connecting thousands of moms - one circle at a time - to meet up in the NYC mom community, and look forward to meeting you soon!

All are welcome - new moms, expectant moms, toddler moms, working moms, single moms in the NYC area:

Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx, Staten Island, Westchester, and Long Island.

    Connect and meet other new and expectant moms, in person and by phone.

    Be part of an intimate open community to be supported and to give support

    Become part of an amazing, friendly, & supportive community

    Make friendships that will last throughout motherhood

Each week we will share videos, articles, and mom to mom resources and more!

The Moms Groups is a safe space for moms to come together for playgroups, moms night out, support and resources for staying sane in the insane world of parenting!


May / June 2016 Offerings are on our Meetup calendar inside:


    New Moms (with babies under 4 months) - begins again May 11, 2016

    New Moms (with babies 4 - 12 months) - begins again May 11, 2016

    Expectant Moms - begins again May 9, 2016

    Toddler Moms - begins again in June 2016 

    Working Moms - begins again May 17, 2016

    Single Moms - Join us for our single moms meetup - May 2016


    2nd Time Moms - begins again May 12, 2016


Our Spring 2016 calendar of events are listed for the community.


Wishing everyone a great beginning of Spring!


Renee, Kerry, Jordana, Julia, and Rebekah

Renee - Many thanks to you for organizing, hosting, and structuring. It's been great, relaxing, entertaining, fun, and insightful - Anneloes


Hi Renee - Wanted to thank you again for all the guidance, perspective and support. They have been a really powerful tool in managing the introduction to parenthood! I'd have a lot more stress, second guessing, and fewer smiles if I had not attended. Hope to see you soon! Thanks, Suzi

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to meet other people suffering from bipolar disorder. To discuss symptoms (and how they effect our jobs, activities and relationships), moods, medications, natural solutions, and treatments in a group that attempts to be as neutral and positive as possible. And maybe even make some new bipolar friends.

I started this group because I was dissatisfied with other groups I had joined in the past. Certain discussions at such group(s) seemed to veer off into inappropriate debates of an offensive socio-political nature, including unnecessarily bringing up inflammatory topics, cultural/ethnic/religious/societal issues, political affiliations, etc. Many seemed set up to be a personal social club for the organizer, with an atmosphere that favored a core group of people who had been in the group longest.

I am not a psychologist/psychiatrist or an expert (although I do read articles on the topic whenever I can), but I do promise to bring my most supportive and neutral self to the group. I would expect others to do the same, particularly due to the vulnerable and sensitive nature of the group and disorder.

On a side note, I do not believe in censorship, and I am all for people having informal conversations (about love, relationships, jobs, art, etc), but I would encourage people to stay away from divisive ones like politics, ethnic, religious and cultural debates. Bipolar people cannot afford to have their day (and mood) ruined by people attempting to exploit the group to further their own personal agendas, demean certain “groups” of people, or use the group as a debate club or an extension of a political party. Those conversations are, by their very nature, animosity provoking in others, emotionally intense and upsetting (especially for bipolar people), and therefore counter-productive to the purpose of the group, which is to be a healing and supportive force in people's lives.

If you want to meet with a group that does it's best to maintain an environment of neutrality and support and STAYS ON TOPIC by not encouraging divisive political or cultural conversations, join this!
results.name: The Apolitical Bipolar Meetup Group

results.description:
Play the exciting game of Riichi Mahjong!

 

These meetups are organized by the United States Professional Mahjong League (USPML).

 

We are currently running two types of events:

* Learn to Play Workshop

A 4-hour crash course for absolute beginners to learn the basics and be able to play the game. Anyone who is interested in learning may attend. No experience necessary. Fun, interactive format - you get to play while you learn.
Info about Learn to Play Workshops

* League Events

A monthly gathering for Riichi Mahjong players of all levels to meet up and play together.
Have fun ~ Improve your skills ~ PLAY.
Beginners who know the rules are welcome! If you've attended a Learn to Play Workshop, you should come to Open Play to practice and have fun playing. Everyone is friendly and welcoming, and we'll have an instructor on hand to help out if you need to review.
Info about Open Play events

 

More about Riichi Mahjong
Riichi (pronounced like "reach") Mahjong is an exciting game for four players. In some ways it is similar to card games like rummy or poker, but it is played with a set of tiles instead of a deck of cards. This game is very popular in Japan, and is rapidly gaining popularity in the United States. Envision a game with its roots in gambling, played by the Yakuza... but with a strong skill component that makes it suitable for competitive play too. Riichi Mahjong retains the excitement of a gambling-style game, but also emphasizes strategy. It is a game with a lot of depth and richness, but most of all, it's REALLY FUN!

More about the USPML
The USPML is a new organization for Riichi mahjong players in America. The USPML works to increase awareness of the game, attract new players, and forge a large and active community of people who love to play.

 

Even more info for the curious:
More than one type of mahjong?

 

Visit us online at www.uspml.com
results.name: US Professional Mahjong League

We are the most active cyclo-centric multi-sport group in the tri-state area.  We also love food.

We believe in and encourage four-season cycling as the healthiest way to commute and be in tune with the best our region has to offer.  Every ride will include a food stop or several, as well as varying cultural, historical, or natural destinations.

We also hike, climb, backpack, camp, and enjoy water and winter sports with equal enthusiasm and vigor.  If you happen to love to do all these things, you have come to the right place.

We have a strict attendance policy, and zero tolerance for any inappropriate behavior, which makes our group a safe haven for considerate, like-minded, smart and self-reliant adventurists on two wheels and in two boots.

Requirements for membership application:

1. Legal name (e.g., "Bob", "Anne B.", etc., NOT "Xxx123", "USA1", etc.)

2. A clear photo of yourself

3. All the questions earnestly answered

4. "Yes" to having read the group rules and that you agree to abide by: http://www.meetup.com/Bike-to-Adventure/pages/FAQ_-_Group_Guidelines_-_Legal_Disclaimer/

5. A membership is for ONE PERSON.  You cannot join as a couple or a group.

If any of the above requirements are not met, or if your email is not reachable by organizers, your membership application will be rejected.

We have annual membership due of $5/yr to help pay for Meetup fees.  Membership dues are not refundable.

***

If you wish to join our hikes, please read this first: http://www.meetup.com/Bike-to-Adventure/pages/Hiking_Etiquette_and_Gear_List.

If you are a serious hiker/climber/mountaineer and want more advanced mountain adventures, please join BaseKamp.

results.description:
Raw food is packed with natural enzymes and nutrients in their natural condition that help the body heal and reach optimal health.

Raw food hasn’t been cooked, processed, microwaved, irradiated or genetically modified. It includes fresh fruits, berries, vegetables, nuts, seeds and herbs; and NO raw meat, fish, milk or eggs.

Join the Raw and Well Long Island meetup group

  • New to the raw food diet?
  • Are you interested in meeting others interested incorporating raw and living foods into their life?

Come to our Potlucks to meet others interested in raw foods and health, get support, share a raw meal, and watch a DVD or live speaker related to the raw foods lifestyle and health.

Welcome to your Raw and Well Long Island

 

Hi I am Chef Vanda, The Organic Personal Chef. With over 20 meet-ups and approaching 200 members, Raw and Well Long Island is a strong and vibrant community and I would like to continue its success and growth.

 

 


We welcome all levels of interest in the Raw Vegan/Living Food Lifestyle from the seasoned raw foodist to those curious of the benefits of a raw food diet. Raw and Well Long Island meetups embody a relaxed kind of setting - with food demonstrations, some fun & educational field trips, pot lucks with themes for the seasons with a little homework to make it interesting, and member suggested ideas - just some of the things to come.

YOU Are Raw and Well Long Island

This group is member driven, we host informal raw vegan potlucks, raw food demonstrations, visit local farms, we seek new raw food restaurants and share our positive raw food experiences. We encourage you to participate with ideas for upcoming events.

We look forward to meeting you at our next events!

Raw and Well Long Island is the group if you want to meet fellow Raw Foodists near you! Come to a local Raw Food Meetup to have fun, share raw food meals, and discuss vegan diet, raw food culture and health issues.

 

We are trying to increase membership, please invite your friends to join our group.

For ingredients, products, appliances and information, go to www.RawAndWell.com.

 

Make it the best day

Namaste

Chef Vanda

Let me know what you're interest are and we will cover those subjects too.

results.description:
• Welcome to your yoga journey!

I've created this meetup group for those interested in developing a  yoga practice, or deepening their current practice. Whether you are a yoga enthusiast , beginner , senior , disabled, or pregnant, yoga brings tremendous personal health benefits. Those who practice it will improve their physical strength as well as attain mental clarity.

I teach a fusion of traditional vinyasa flow and core strength fitness yoga for a more physical workout. These sessions build strength, and flexibility, condition the breath to remain calm, but focused, bring students to their natural weight, and create overall wellness. Class can be adapted for any shape, size and age. This practice will bring students to their healthiest self, while learning to honor their own unique pace, needs, and goals. Please visit the class calendar for Basics class, Gentle classes, Open class, and Restorative class.

If you would like to practice yoga but have difficulty moving up and down from the floor, please try one of the Chair Yoga classes. Chair Yoga classes are for those who are unable to take part in a routine yoga class setting.This form of yoga is energizing, yet restoring. Practitioners build strength, and alignment, form balance, and mobility, and detox the system. Postures are modified to accommodate those with physical ailments, and focus on individual’s needs. In this class, we will work from chairs, the wall, or use props.

Please know that Private lessons are available for children, prenatal, and yoga therapy. Especially children in need of individual care due to Cystic Fibrosis, or autoimmune disorders. Yoga is also a great way for parents to share time with their child/children. Group lessons are also available.

The studio for this class is ADA-accessible, parking is free.

LOCATION: All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd Staten Island, N.Y. 10314. walk-in's welcome.

Classes are held inside the actual church, surrounded by stain glass. The atmosphere adds to the peace and serenity a yoga practice can bring.

CLASS SCHEDULE: $15 per session, $10 for Seniors

MONDAY   9:30am RESTORATIVE Yoga class

results.description:
We welcome any new or experienced motorcycle rider of any type of motorcycle be it sports or touring of any maker. This is about riders who just want to spend time riding on a bike and enjoy the company of bunch of people on the road.Members need to learn more about hand signals and group riding formations in our group rides. We strive to make every ride a pleasant if not a great experience.

Exploring farm roads, back roads,  country roads in Upper Westchester, Great Hudson valley area, and Connecticut are our main rides. Sometimes we ride across other states  for more experience riders. No alcohol and drugs allowed.

Safe driving is our first priority and by joining you do so at your own risk.

results.description:
The worlds of hackers and journalists are coming together as reporting goes digital and Internet companies become media empires.

Journalists call themselves "hacks," someone who can churn out words in any situation. Hackers use the digital equivalent of duct tape to whip out code. Hacker-journalists try and bridge the two worlds.

This group is to bring all these people together -- those who are working to help people make sense of their world. It's for hackers exploring technologies to filter and visualize information, and for journalists who use technology to find and tell stories. In the age of information overload, all their work has become even more crucial.

This group aims to help members find inspiration and think in new directions, bringing together potential collaborators for projects and new ventures.

Please also check out our blog at http://hackshackers.com

Help us build the future of media!

Our conversations will include marketing and advertising so we can help get apps in the hands of our target audience and fund the work we are doing.

Join us in shaping the conversation and topics of this group and please make suggestions on topics and guest speakers you would like to help advance our leaning.

results.description:
People of intermediate to advanced skill levels who enjoy playing volleyball and improving their fundamentals should join right up!  This Meetup group features opportunities for levels of play from  adult to intermediate and advanced level players looking to play competitive volleyball and become part of the local volleyball community.

We offer weeknight open gym play for players who consider themselves to be of intermediate or advanced skill.  We try to offer skills training opportunities throughout the summer months for beginners, intermediate, and even the most advanced players wanting to improve their knowledge of the game and fundamental skills.

There are some small costs associated with participation to cover costs of gym space, outdoor nets, volleyballs, and insurance and administrative costs associated with running any form of organization.  Please understand our need to cover once-per-year $25/player insurance costs to make certain everyone is protected under our liability policy, and our average $10/night or $25/tournament expenses essentially allow us to continue providing a quality and safe playing environment.

This summer, and hopefully many thereafter, we're looking to organize King/Queen of the court tournaments for players looking to get out of the house, get some exercise, have fun, and meet with others looking to do the same.  This format involves having everyone play with everyone else on their net as partners against various combinations of all the other players. It means lots of play with lots of different partners, and the opportunity to see how good of a teammate you can become!

This Meetup group is sponsored by the Morris County Volleyball Club (MCVC) and LYS Sports Academy.
results.name: The Morris County Volleyball Meetup Group

results.description: This group is for Black conservatives in New York City. Regardless of your party affiliation, if you are tired of the big government, out of control spending, highre taxes, the liberal press, white liberals playing us as nothing but "victims" and the Obama/Pelosi/Reid do-nothing Congress then this is the group for you.

results.description:
About us:

Welcome all artists, writers, scientists, actors, photographers, business people, researchers, inventors, entrepreneurs, musicians, actors, craftspeople, architects, computer lovers, filmmakers, business people, Youtube video-makers, philosophers, PEOPLE OF CREATIVE INTERESTS of any kind. 

Anyone is welcome, even outside the area (though it is probably be more difficult to do #4 of list below).

Here is our mission:

1. SHARE: Feel free to shamelessly post your work and show it to everyone here. You can post finished work or unfinished work and asked to be critiqued or for suggestions. Only work that explicitly asks for critiques can be critiqued. 

2. SUPPORT: Feel free to share your creative aspirations, goals, and/or vision. Please list venues or anything where we all can showcase work. Also, ASK ANYONE FOR HELP OR RESOURCES to reach your aims.

3. COLLABORATE: We can spontaneously form collaborations on creative work (especially INTERDISCIPLINARY). I encourage cross-discipline stuff, such as engineers working with artists (I seen this happen, its amazing). We can contribute our talents to each other. For instance, you might want to learn a skill from someone, an artist might need to find a web designer, or someone might know of way to sell artwork. 

4. PLAY: We will get together time to time to discuss ideas, and also set up creative play-dates in the New Jersey/NYC area. We can set up events to learn how to improv, make crafts together, make sushi, do magic, have costume parties, make really bizarre treasure hunts. We can also ask each other to do creative things, like post challenges on this page for each other. Come on, we are creative, we can come up with PLENTY IDEAS FOR FUN! We can also just throw a party.

May the Fun Begin!
Leon Tsao 
(Masters in Creativity Psychology, artist, musician, researcher, writer, philosopher, teacher, cartoonist)

Feel free to post events that you think would be relevant to our community!
results.name: The Creative Instigators

results.description:
This group is dedicated to local, social and mobile online marketing.  Our group is filled with people passionate about helping local businesses and organizations get the word out on social media, search, email, directories, mobile and everywhere you need to be.  

Our Members

We are filled with diverse and passionate members and experts:

    Owners of small-to-medium size businesses

    PR professionals looking to leverage online channels

    Entrepreneurs who want to grow their business

    Technology and service partners developing their expertise

    Local publishers and bloggers looking at ways to drive revenue

Now more than ever, consumers are going online to get all their news and information or getting it pushed to their email and mobile devices.   Local businesses need to be where their customers are! 

Our Events

We host regular panels with leading experts from Yipit, Thrillist, Foodspotting, Groupon, Local Response, PR agencies, bloggers and local business conglomerates to help you navigate the rapidly changing the landscape and become an expert.

We run regular meetups to discuss how to:

    Optimize your online presences across multiple channels

    Leverage social media (Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Tumblr)

    Manage your directories & reputation management (Google Places, Yelp, CitySearch, FourSquare, Mapquest, etc.) 

    Drive loyalty marketing (email marketing, Facebook, Twitter, promotions & deals)

    Execute effective PR strategies and blogger outreach

    Leverage new tools, technologies and trends

Join us at our next event!
results.name: Local Business Online Marketing & Advertising Headquarters

results.description:
Welcome to The Indigo Papillon-A center for Wisdom and Enlightenment!

My mission is to help others learn and achieve their metaphysical and spiritual goals in a safe, nonjudgmental environment. To help others in their personal journey of transformation, and to help them understand that it is an ability we all possess.

The name holds great significance for me: Indigo refers to our third eye and clear seeing, Papillion is French for butterfly- a symbol of transformation. This center's purpose is to help and guide through that journey of transformation, through learning, sharing, and growing.

We all have psychic ability whether or not we are aware of it. The classes that will be offered will allow you to explore in a way that is gentle and non-judgmental. I take great joy in helping others to discover what is already there.

About me:

I am a Psychic-Medium in NJ and New England. I specialize in card reading, but in many other modalities as well; such as Flower reading, Spirit guide communication, Mediumship work, Angel communication, Animal communication, object & picture readings, and chord cutting. I am a Reiki practitioner and Energetic healer, teach classes, and more. I have spoken at Fairly Dickinson University, lectured, and been on a variety of radio shows. Feel free to ask questions or suggest a class or event you would like to see offered.

Are you a working professional or college student who prefers the company of other geeks? Do you find yourself frequently wishing there was some sort of watering hole for people like you who watch Adult Swim, revel in the joys of DDR/video games, read esoteric books, and indulge shamelessly in intelligent debate? Do you hate hipsters with an undying passion? results.description:
Central Park, a world of its own, is also one of the most beautiful and fascinating parks on the planet.  Every little hill and valley, crevice and corner, rock formation and grove of trees, lake and bridge, provide inspiration to any artist who would bring his sketchpad or easel.  Lovers, musicians, skaters, cyclists, dog walkers, sunbathers, frisbee players, parents with children, and even artists themselves provide a rich palette of human subject matter. Come and join other painters, our colleagues in spirit, as we create spontaneous works of art in Central Park for all to enjoy.

We are hoping to meet once a month.  Members are requested to bring their own materials.  I am an artist who paints in oil, acrylic and water color.  I have curated many exhibitions, and plan to eventually present another event based on selected works from Plein-Air.

www.plein-airpaintersofcentralpark.com

results.description:
Enjoy intimate, interesting, unscripted and unpredictable conversation with a thought leader from the startup community. Let’s share some delicious food and awesome conversation. To keep it interactive we will be limiting breakfast to  twelve people.

 

Participate in round table discussion. Pull up a chair! Our esteemed guest will speak for a couple of minutes just talking about what is interesting right now, and then in a closed door, no cell phone, no tweeting session, we will chat, ask questions, tell stories and connect in real time. At the very least, you will leave having enjoyed some interesting conversation and a good breakfast, and at best you will have some new idea or insight that makes you think and perhaps act.

results.description: “Professor Chocolate” is actually a combination of two chocophiles in search of the world’s best chocolate. New York City is furnished with an astonishing collection of chocolatiers who are committed to making artisanal chocolate with only the freshest ingredients. There are more than 60 different chocolate shops, boutiques, stores and factories scattered throughout the city. Many of these shops are small and run by only a few people, making your chocolate-tasting experience that much more intimate. Finding your way to one or all of these locations is no problem at all now that you have arrived at this Meetup site. The Professors will be your own personal guides! Check back frequently for our Chocolate Tour Meetups so you can experience the tasting of some of the best hand-crafted chocolate there is to offer.

topics.name: Restoring the US Constitution in Government

results.description:
Welcome to NYCIR, the best indie scene in Manhattan for liberty-minded New Yorkers!

Discover NY'ers who value their inalienable right to life, liberty and pursuit of happiness. Our ‘indie’ label suits all who wish to promote their freedom in a voice that's distinct from big franchise GOP types.

Tired of being slandered by the Left? Frustrated by the self-defeating ways of the Right? Want to be a better communicator and advocate for Liberty? 

Then join our friendly community of New York Ex-Liberals, Free Marketeers, Free Thinkers, Constitutionalists and grassroot strategists whose vision of Liberty and Republicanism coincides with Enlightenment Thinkers such as John Locke, Edmund Burke, Thomas Jefferson, James Madison, Bastiat and Alexis de Tocqueville. 

Our Meetups will educate and embolden you to fight for a world where self-determination, property rights and economic freedom is respected.  

Discover the timeless principles to the US Constitution; stand up to collectivism and fascism; reclaim your liberty and happiness.  

You'll get the chance to grow your social and professional network, and help shape local and state politics. Our events are conveniently headquartered in various midtown locations in Manhattan. 

First time attendees will receive a copy of the Declaration of Independence and Constitution.

“Where an excess of power prevails, property of no sort is duly respected.
No man is safe in his opinions, his person, his faculties, or his possessions."
~
James Madison
Author, US Constitution & Bill of Rights
Original (Indie) Republican

Join Now!

Check out our Political Directory of other Center Right Groups
results.name: New York City Indie Republicans Meetup

Stop trying to get your work done in an overcrowded Starbucks, in an unequipped home office, or in a quiet library where you can't make phone calls.

The coffee is FREE, FREE tea, FREE snacks and FREE high-speed Wi-Fi.  Oh and there is a great happy hour down the street and a train station.

We are looking for freelancers, consultants, programmers, small business owners, telecommuters, independent professionals and more.

results.description:
Welcome to the NYC Latino Professionals Meetup!

Networking. Cultural Events. Community Service.

The NYC Latino Professionals Meetup ("NYCLP") is a medium for Latina/Latino Professionals to expand their network while having fun and helping the community.  #NYCLP is a diverse mix of white-collar Latina/Latino professionals: from lawyers and finance professionals to teachers and social workers.  Almost all of our members have at least a Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree.  Many of our members have, or are pursuing, advanced degrees.

Our Latino membership also reflects the immense diversity within the Latin America diaspora. Our members were born or raised in the United States or in Latin America.  What brings us together is a sense of Latino community and a desire to network and socialize with current and future movers and shakers.

#NYCLP hosts upscale Latino networking events, exclusive cultural events, and innovative career development/leadership workshops in New York City and Northern NJ. We also engage in community service projects and organize charity happy hours.  We are educated and dedicated to our Latino community, but we are also a whole lot of fun.

Since we seek tively engaged members, we strongly prefer that you are a member of not more than 12 meetup groups.  Membership is at Organizer's discretion. We prefer quality over quantity.

NETWORKING

#NYCLP hosts NYC's premiere Latino networking happy hour!

CULTURAL EVENTS:

We embrace and celebrate our Latino culture!

#NYCLP also hosts/organizes other types of events, including wine tastings, Sunday brunches, Latin dinner, out-of-town trips and nights of Latin dancing.  #NYCLP loves salsa, merengue, bachata. #NYCLP has some amazing dancers who are friendly!  Join Us!!!

Do you want to feel good and improve the quality of your life, meeting likeminded people in the process? Do you enjoy reading books about Mind, Body and Spirit? Would you like to empower yourself with a proven, practical approach to life? Whether you're a beginner or have more experience with the Law of Attraction philosophy, the Law of Attraction Centre is perfect for you.

The Law of Attraction Centre, first established in London, UK in 2003, is the largest and most talked about Law of Attraction community in Europe.

This open-minded, open-hearted philosophy has been described as 'the teaching at the heart of all spiritual paths', and yet transcends any one belief system. People from all backgrounds resonate with it as it is so simple and freeing, non-judgemental and self-empowering. We welcome and embrace everyone.

Leading Law of Attraction teachers, Michael James and Tracy Friend run regular workshops where there is the opportunity to deepen your understanding and experience with the Law of Attraction.

Join us to experience for yourself how good your life can be, meeting fun, friendly and inspirational people along the way.

They are pleased to share with you real-life success stories from the groups and workshops of how the Law of Attraction, the groups and the processes are working for people. Please see: http://www.lawofattractioncentre.com/law-of-attraction-success-stories/

To receive the regular newsletter with further inspirational success stories from the Law of Attraction Centre members, articles and exclusive tips to create your own reality please sign up at: http://www.lawofattractioncentre.com/subscribe/

For more information about the Law of Attraction Centre, please see: www.lawofattractioncentre.com

For further inspiration we have the Law of Attraction Centre Blog and inspirational articles that have been in the media.

Follow the Law of Attraction Centre on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Google Plus, Instagram and Pinterest.

We look forward to meeting you soon.

Best wishes,

Tracy Friend & Michael James

results.description:
Success calls to you

It does, doesn’t it? I know it sounds corny but we’ve all heard success calling to us. The question is whether or not we’ve answered the call.

This is the home base of our “Success Calls” seminar and assisted networking series on meetup. We currently have 2 meetings monthly in different locations in Northern New Jersey: Elmwood Park,  and Little Falls - both lunch time meetings

Our goal is to offer you an opportunity for learning and development for yourselves or your staff at an affordable price along with the opportunity to meet and network with other like-minded individuals. Dawn Johnson, our co-facilitator will help you in this process.

We want to offer you “meaty” mini-seminars that you leave feeling that you have learned something new, brushed up on an existing skill or gained additional insights.  Use Dawn's fountain of knowledge to help you connect with others. Network with the other people in attendence.

Whether we have 3 people or 30 in attendance, we want you to feel you have spent your time wisely.

These meetings are pay as you go. There are no membership fees, no obligations beyond the $15 cost to attend each meeting. This does not include the cost of any food/beverage you may choose to purchase (but if you could purchase lunch that’d be great – the venues serve excellent food at very reasonable prices). Simply come to the one you’re interested. Our topics will range from selling skills to cold calling to inside sales and service, to leadership and motivation. We hope you find it worth your while and come back again to which every locations suits you best, to hear which ever topic is important to you. Please tell your colleagues about us.

When/Where:
2 times each month – choose what’s best for you.

Cost
$15 plus your cost of any food/beverages

results.description:
The only reason to join my meetup is if you're someone who wants to know as much as possible about bipolar disorder, especially in regards to how best to thrive with our disorder. I come armed with numerous thorough, expensive and informative Psychiatric textbooks, a few Clinical Psychology Textbooks, as well as numerous excellent books on Bipolar Disorder, which you will have full access to once you join the group. The books alone are worth thousands of dollars. Then I also add to the mix professional, peer-reviewed papers found on PubMed or PsychINFO that address salient issues that those with Bipolar Disorder must face.

I ask for a $40 initiation fee from each member not to cover the costs of the thousands of dollars of excellent written resources that you'd otherwise be without. Rather, I ask for a one-time $40 fee to show your support of my emails reviewing literature that are very easy to read when some of these original documents/textbooks are not written for the general public. In my emails, I also share my personal struggles/insights that come from having Bipolar Disorder myself. You also get stellar email responses from other members who share your passion for knowing as much as possible about what may help us get better while weeding out the junk information that is not credible.

A little more about me. I don't mean to boast, but I feel I must if I am to ask for your money to hear from me. I was a medical student at New York Medical College in Westchester when I was diagnosed with Bipolar Disorder type I. After my diagnosis, I found medical school to be much more of a struggle, especially during my third year when I was suicidally depressed while having to work extremely hard on the wards, only to go home to more studying in a perpetual state of sleep deprivation. Anyone with Bipolar Disorder knows that extreme sleep deprivation and highly stressful environments can make it incredibly hard to thrive with our disease. I'm skipping over a little bit of the story here, but basically I decided to pursue a Psy.D. in Clinical Psychology instead of pursuing a residency in Psychiatry because 1. I would learn psychotherapy much better this way and 2. I would not have to subject myself to a lifestyle that is incompatible with my illness. While there's a bit more to the story, what I shared is a pretty good summary of what happened.

I have a few test scores that I wish to share because I think it helps me justify asking for an initiation fee, while I don't like boasting. On the Psychiatry shelf exam (the test all third year medical students take to assess how well they understand/can properly treat Psychiatric illness, I scored 2 standard deviations above the national mean. That means 98% of the nation's med students scored below me on this assessment of our mastery of Psychiatry. Then in order to apply to the field of Clinical Psychology, I took the GRE Psychology subject test and got a 790 with 98% scoring below me again. The point is I humbly consider myself on the road to becoming a true expert on Bipolar Disorder and Clinical Psychology/Psychiatry in general. This means I can answer a lot of your questions, and I'm a very good researcher so I can almost always look up the answer when I don't know it.

And finally, the $40 buys you the ability to ask me to provide a detailed summary of whatever topic you are interested in, so long as it pertains to Bipolar Disorder or Psychiatry more generally. Since I work for you, I ask for a one-time fee for compensation.

 

Here are the topics that I review on a regular basis:

*The importance of sleep in Bipolar Disorder, including how we can best get ourselves sleeping well

*A review of the things that those with Bipolar Disorder do who thrive that is different from the rest of us. This includes understanding the importance of trying to spot depression or mania as early on as possible, and then act in such a way as to prevent a pathological state from occurring. I believe everyone with Bipolar Disorder who wishes to thrive must play a very active role in self-monitoring and prevention of disease states.

*Reevaluating the nature of hypomania and mania, and how it's different from genuine well-being. I share why I believe living without hypomania (or mania) is ideal for me. I challenge those who are drawn to reexperiencing hypomania or mania to consider the wisdom and how much more rewarding living a symptomless life can be.

*How to thrive with Bipolar Disorder at work and school, and the importance of becoming aware of the cognitive deficits that are common to Bipolar Disorder.

*Everything you didn't know about why lithium and other mood stabilizers are good for the Bipolar brain and how lithium is the best drug for preventing suicide in individuals with Bipolar Disorder.

*Suicide, especially focusing on elucidating how big a problem is it and what can we do to get out of a suicidal situation.

*Understanding how we differ from a "normal" person, even when we are in our "normal" state (aka when we're euthymic).

*The importance of getting regular blood work to prevent organ damage that might otherwise result in extensive damage as this type of organ damage largely occurs silently.

*Thorough review of all medication related to Bipolar Disorder, including efficacy and common side effects. In particular, I focus on antipsychotics, and how best to balance desired effect with the potential for horrible side effects.

*Understanding Bipolar Depression, which is different from Unipolar Depression and generally harder to treat. On average someone with Bipolar Disorder will spend 3x more time in a state of depression than mania.

*The power of Positive Psychology to help with all things Bipolar, most especially when one suffers from depression.

*A review of the major forms of psychotherapies being used for Bipolar Disorder, including efficacy and when they're indicated.

*A review of how Dialectic Behavioral Therapy (DBT) may be a critical component in the treatment of many individuals with Bipolar Disorder.

*Quirky facts about Bipolar Disorder like how on average people with Bipolar Disorder are smarter than the general population, noteworthy characters in history/the media who have Bipolar Disorder, the truth behind the mad genius stereotype, and when are we most creative.

*A review of the neuroscience associated with Bipolar Disorder.

 

I could keep listing topics, but I've probably already overwhelmed the reader with my list. Any member can email me asking for a synopsis on any of these topics or any other topic that you believe is important, and I will respond with an informative and easily readable summary of the salient points. If I drop the ball and do not produce such a response within 3 weeks of your request, then I will grant you a full refund of your initiation fee.

Note: This meetup is currently too small for regular in person meetups, but it is constantly growing so I'm confident in the not-so-distant future we will do in person meetups regularly. That was the primary aim of my meetup when I brought it into inception. In the meantime, if it's in person meetups that you're primarily after, I refer you to the numerous other excellent Bipolar Disorder support groups offered on meetup that are based in NYC. That said, we will do occasional meetups, and, again, I promise in the not-so-distant future we will start doing in person meetups frequently.

I think I finally stopped talking. Thank you for reading this far if you did. And to those who are about to join, I say "Welcome!"
results.name: Bipolars in Transition to a Better Life

results.description:
This group is about getting together once per month at various restaurants around Manhattan. All that is required is a desire to meet other singles over 40 who share a passion about good food.

The focus will be on restaurants in Manhattan and the most popular type of restaurants: Steakhouses, Fish Restaurants, Italian, etc.

Restaurants selected will be in the $10 - $50 per person range .

There are no meetings, just RSVP that you can make it. It's that simple.

Open to single men and women 40 years old or over.

----------------------

This group will schedule dinner out once per month beginning in September, 2010. RSVPs will be limited to 8 people per month with a waitlist.  This allows members to get to know each other on a more intimate level and we don't get stuck with "group" limitations that restaurants sometimes impose.

When the date of dinner rolls around, simply show up 10 minutes early - outside if it is nice or inside if it isn't, and, we'll get to know each other over dinner.  If you arrive late, reservations will usually be made under my name "Vena Moore."


Billing is simple, everyone pays for their own including tax and tip (15%-20%).  The only other requirements are that you are 40 or over, single, enjoy dining out and making new friends, and, for those who are single parents - this is about the adults so leave the kiddies at home.

That's it. No sales pitches. No forced dating or mix and mingles. The simple act of dining together in the hopes of making new friends.
results.name: New York Singles Over 40 Dinner Club

results.description: A separation or a divorce can be overwhelming and devastating. Life as we knew it is torn apart and we need support from others. Most people are unprepared for the emotional turmoil, mental anguish and practical side of breakups or divorce. If you are separated, going through a divorce, or newly single our support group can help you feel empowered and ease the process. As a Breakups and Divorce Coach dedicated to support and empowerment during difficult times, each meetup will be facilitated and feature a theme that is specific to breakups, divorce and renewal. They may be related to emotions, healing, practical concerns, communication, relationships or dating again. We'll have a presentation, discussion, group sharing, and an exercise or techniques that will help us apply the concepts directly to our lives. If you would like to be supported, encouraged, inspired and more empowered then please join. The only criterion is that you are contemplating or going through a breakup, divorce, or are recovering and renewing from one. Bring your concerns, questions, open minds and healing hearts!
results.name: Empowerment During Breakups and Divorce Support Group NYC

We are a community of professionals between the ages of 21-39 that get together with the goal of making meaningful connections, developing in our lives and making a difference in the world around us. Doing this through sophisticated and engaging events is what sets us apart from any other ‘young professionals’ group out there.

 

JOIN OUR GROUP if you are a polished, upscale young professional looking to make new professional contacts or if you just want to make new friends while enjoying exciting events.

 

WITH US, YOU WILL enjoy the best in NJ/NYC professional & social life. We offer both large, broad, all-purpose events as well as smaller, intimate, more focused affairs so that our members can attend the event that best suits their interest.

 

To learn more about the specific types of events we offer, check out our ‘Event Details’ page.

results.description:
Want to learn how to code? Have a great idea? Don't be shy. Develop it.

Girl Develop It is an non-profit organization that exists to provide affordable and accessible programs to women who want to learn software and web development through mentorship and hands-on instruction.

Our vision is to create a network of empowered women who feel confident in their abilities to code and build beautiful web and mobile applications. By teaching women around the world from diverse backgrounds to learn software development, we can help women improve their careers and confidence in their everyday lives.

Thank you for supporting Girl Develop It on our mission to make software development easy, affordable and accessible to all women. Your contribution helps us expand our mission to create great programs and opportunities for women learning to code.

Are you a GDI NYC member? Follow us on Twitter to connect with others and join our Slack channel. 

Help out at upcoming events by acting as a Volunteer, Teaching Assistant or inspire someone to learn how to code as an Instructor. Complete the Girl Develop It NYC | Instructor, Teaching Assistant, and Volunteer Information form 

If your company is interested in donating venue space to host our events, please complete the Girl Develop It NYC | Donated Venue Information form

Unable to afford a class you're interested in taking? Apply for a scholarship.

Interested in sending a job posting or does your company want to sponsor a student? Contact us!

Note: While we focus our mission and messaging to women, we're women inclusive, not women only.

For more information on Girl Develop It, visit http://girldevelopit.com.

Refund Policy

If you can no longer attend the class you signed up and paid for, your payment will be donated to the local chapter scholarship fund. This helps us keep class costs low and you can help another woman in need!

results.description:
Those of us who love running in Queens get to experience the best of all worlds.  We are in the greatest city in the world, in the most diverse county in the country.  We have fantastic parks in our borough - and even two major airports to carry us to distant races.  We have beaches.  We have challenging hills and shady trees.  We have a Major League Baseball team, a world-class tennis center (and tournament), and have been the home to more people of influence than you can count on all of our hands.  We are runners, and we love Queens.  

The[b] Queens NYC Runners[/b] is a group designed to provide a comfortable, casual, friendly and safe environment for its members.  We organize group runs in neighborhoods throughout the borough.  Some of our runs include training provided by certified coaches.  We also offer access to individual coaching, if that's what you want.  All of our runs are collaborative - regardless of whether you are an experienced ultramarathoner or rarely rise from the couch, you will never be left behind.  We look after each other, believe in helping to foster community and keep each other wanting to return for the next event.  Many of our events end at a local pub or restaurant, to allow us to socialize and revel in our fitness.

This group is run by and for its members.  If you would like to run in a particular area, know of an upcoming race, have a suggestion/question/comment or any sort of concern, please email the organizer.  You are also encouraged to post in the Ideas section or Message Board.
results.name: Queens NYC Runners

results.description:
Are you a woman with a successful business? If you were to divorce, would you want your ex-husband and his new wife as your business partners?

I didn’t think so.

Sadly, 52% of first marriages and 70% of second and third marriages end in divorce. Any woman entrepreneur who is happily married now—or who plans to get married—needs to understand and manage the business risks associated with divorce.

And that's exactly what this group is all about.

We'll discuss the various techniques that can be used to protect your business from a possible future divorce as well as your options if a divorce is more imminent.

Please remember, if you wait until you are faced with divorce, it will already be too late to implement most preventive measures. To be legally effective, these protections must be in place years before divorce is even a thought—either before you are married, or while you are still happily married. The sooner you take preventive steps, the more likely you will be able to protect your business from a divorce.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meeting.

Thanks - Jeff Landers
results.name: Divorce-Proof Your Woman Owned Business

We'll give you 5 minutes to show off your tool, hack, library (did you just write a library to access the Meetup API in Go!?), whatever. We're language / software/ hardware agnostic, so it's all fair game.

After you present, it's an open forum. The audience will ask questions and provide feedback. We want to enable as much participation as possible at these meetups, so you'd better be able to take criticism and dish it out (all within reason of course).

Our mailing list has a strict no recruiters and no promotion of commercial projects policy. If you think that your message to the list might not be appropriate, either run it by the organizers, or don't send it! Violators will be banned as soon as possible--no questions asked!

results.description:
Speed-dating can be expensive. The entry price alone is around $35 to $40, and then you have the drinks and transportation... This would all be fine if you felt pretty sure you were going to meet your one-and-only that night, but often you simply need to go a few times to come across the person that's right for you.

Don't get us wrong - we're huge fans of speed-dating. We think it way better than online dating, as you can not beat a quick face-to-face encounter to establish if the chemistry is right. We'd just like to make it a little cheaper, especially in times when we're all being conscious about what we spend our money on. And remember, the product is actually you, and the other 30 fabulous NYC singles attending - why should we pay $50 for that.

Our aim is simple - we want to inform our members of cheap or free spots at speed-dating events, and/or ensure that you're enjoying a free or inexpensive drink or appetizers while you there.

This is not as hard as you might think. Unlike other singles events, speed-dating companies must almost exactly balance the number of men and women attending. It's not uncommon(for example) for a speed-dating company to be short eight women aged 28-37 the night before the event. They contact us, we shoot for free or maximum $25 spots, and everyone is happy.

Now, here's the catch. We need you to play your part - in other words, if you rsvp to say you want to come, then you do need to show up. And at the event, as many of the participants will have paid full price, then to avoid any grumpiness, we would ask that you don't share your discounted or free rate.

So if you're someone who is single and looking to date, is budget conscious, and can be a little flexible and spontaneous when offers come your way, then this Meetup group is for you! And there is no downside to joining - we'll simply inform you of free or cheap spots, and if you want to come, you rsvp. We will then contact you to let you know if you have a spot (i.e., you don't have a spot just by RSVPing here, you have a spot once you register with a free or discount code on the speed-dating site).

Looking forward to helping you get dates!

Jen
results.name: New York Discounted Speeddating Group

results.description:
Black feminism, Latina feminism, indigenous women's feminism is about harnessing the power of women of color as agents of knowledge and as agents of change. By coming together as women of color, as self-defined, self-reliant individuals confronting race, gender, sexuality and class oppression, it speaks to the importance that knowledge and solidarity plays in empowering ourselves and other oppressed people.

Sisters, this group is for women of color who wish to come together in dialogue and in authentic forms of support and affirmation. It is a group to help us move our feminist ideology out of our intellectual minds and heads into our day to day work and lives. It is a group committed to the affirmation of feminist/womanist thought and to moving beyond critical thinking to actual strategy and action.

The artist, poet, social worker, non-profit leader, community organizer, mother and other....YOU'RE INVITED! Join us and network, share ideas, outrage, and stories, and discuss strategies for empowering ourselves and for empowering others.
results.name: Women of Color Feminists/Womanists Dialogue & Support Group

Unlike most meet-ups we are not just going to sit around and talk about it...or go watch a movie or show...we are going to be about it. We will be making short and feature film, print work such as publicity catalog and calender shoots.
All forms of talent are desired, but you must be as serious as we are, slackers and no-shows will be booted.

So what are you waiting for? Join now and become the influence you want to be.

results.description:
Do you enjoy wine?  Learning?  An expert?  Are you 30+ and looking for a way to meet down to earth people who share your enjoyment of wine? 

About every 6 weeks, the Manhattan and Astoria Wine & Social will either put together a food and wine dinner, find a great deal at a good wine bar, or even just go to a good wine bar.  If you are looking for relaxed folks who can find no better way to start or end and evening than with good wine, you have found the place.

We are non-discriminatory on geography (we don't care where in Manhattan and the boroughs we go), non-discriminatory on wine (although we lean toward red), non-discriminatory on type of food, and occasionally might go crazy and choose a non-wine liquor event!  There is though only one thing we discriminate on, we must have quality wine, and only good wine. 

We are always looking for bars with great wine lists (Domaine, Crescent and Vine), and good solid BYOB restaurants as well.  We like themes and of course good food with our wine. 

 

So for 2013 we are looking at the following plans:

Return to Domaine (LIC) and Claret (Sunnyside) as both were spectacular events in 2011/2, and Terroir again. 

Spanish dinner for $40 including wine (no kidding)

Try a couple of odd regions or grapes (haven't decided yet, but 2011 Croatia was fabulous)

2013 3rd Annual Furniture in the Yard July/August Soire

2013 vertical tasting (TBD)

Private Boutique Tasting

Occasional Field Test (where not even the organizers have been)

Send us your ideas, and if anyone wants to help organize, we can always use your help!


Welcome!
results.name: Astoria and Manhattan Wine & Social

results.description:
WHO ARE WE?

We are a diverse meetup group providing a platform for New Jersey singles (male and female) over 40 to meet other singles for friendship or maybe even find someone special, while participating in fun activities. We know it can be difficult taking that first step to get out there and meet people you don't know. However, by providing fun, social events in a comfortable, non-threatening atmosphere, we can take that step together. You've got an automatic built in set of friends! This is YOUR meetup group and it is only as good as its members. We welcome all suggestions for activities and possible venues, and we encourage people from all ethnicities and backgrounds.

 

In order to ensure a pleasant experience for all, please note the following:

 

RSVP YES ONLY

We are a RSVP YES ONLY GROUP. Please let us know when you are able to attend an event by responding Yes. If you are unable to attend, please do not RSVP No--There is no need to respond. (Can you imagine if we received 120 No’s and 20 Yes’s? The event would certainly look unpopular and no one would be interested in going.)

 

CHANGING YOUR RSVP YES TO NO

If you RSVP Yes and can't make an event, please change your RSVP to No. It is a policy of this groups that anyone who RSVP's to a dinner event and does not show will be removed from the group. This is especially important when reservations have been made with a restaurant and there is a waiting list. Please be respectful of the organizer and the other members.

 

BE CAREFUL!

By attending any of this group’s events, you are assuming responsibility for your own safety. Everyone should drink responsibly, and make sure that you are physically able to attend strenuous activities like bowling, tennis, etc.
results.name: Over 40 Fun Loving Singles in New Jersey

results.description:
Welcome to the Social Media for Small Business MeetUp Group!

The agenda and goals for this group are to learn the techniques, tools and tips to help your business grow and prosper on the web. There is a lot to know and the digital landscape is changing every week. We will extend invitations to attend workshops and panels with industry professionals, insiders and influencers willing to share their knowledge and services in the world of social media and selling via the social web. We will also present webinars, Twitter chats and YouTube Hangouts to help you stay up to date. Ultimately we all seek to be ahead of the curve. Social media is one of the most timely ways to exchange the actionable intel that can propel our endeavors.

The topics small business owners are finding helpful in social media and online marketing are primarily Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and blogging. We will cover those as well as the growing areas of content and video marketing. Other helpful events will focus on digital advertising logistics, accounting and financial planning.

We also schedule events like art shows and movie premiere passes because building a social network is not all about analytics, backlinks and seo. Often times its about getting to know people, feeling comfortable with others that have similar goals and even having fun while developing strong business relationships.

Feel free to reach out to us via the social links you use the most or hit us up here (after all, MeetUp is a social network too)! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jottDMuLesU&feature=youtu.be
results.name: Social Media for Small Business

results.description:
Welcome to the Young Naturists America meetup group!

YNA is a nudist / naturist organization founded in 2010 by Jordan Blum & Felicity Jones. The goal of our organization is to promote naturism and social nudity as well as to educate. We also aim to raise awareness of social issues that are important to us. We advocate for causes such as acceptance, tolerance, positive body image, top-free equality and anti-bullying to name a few.

What is nudism / naturism? The practice of going naked either alone or in social settings, without overt sexual behavior. We do many of the same fun activities others do every day, just without clothes! ie beach meetups, swimming, hiking, body painting, dancing, partying, sports, & more. Naturism, or nudism, is not about sex or sexuality, and many of the same behavioral rules apply as in any other public social setting.

We are based in NYC and organize events in the northeast as well as in other regions through our YNA chapters. This group will primarily be for events in NY, NJ, PA & throughout the northeast.

We welcome everyone regardless of appearance, ethnicity, sexual orientation, piercings, religion, gender identity, etc. This group is for naturists of all kinds, from people who grew up with it, to people who would just like to see what it's about.

BEFORE YOU REQUEST TO JOIN: Please have a face photo of yourself on your profile and make sure to put some thought into our membership questions. We will not accept one to two-word answers on every question. Thanks!

NOTE: Meetup is not an accurate measure of how many people are attending an event, nor of our gender ratio. We use many platforms to promote events / meetups, and many of our members do not use Meetup. While 12 people might RSVP here, the actual event might have upwards of 80 people.

http://youngnaturistsamerica.com

results.description:
"Meditation is an adventure, an adventure into the unknown -- the greatest adventure that the human mind can take." - Osho

If you want to live a more fulfilled life, first you will want to know your potential, who you really are. Meditation is the route to that knowing.It is a methodology of science of awareness.

Many meditative techniques require one to sit still and silent. But for most of us accumulated stress in our bodymind makes that difficult. Before we can hope to access our inner powerhouse of consciousness, we need to let go of our tensions.

Osho (1931-1990) is an enlightened mystic who has given many new techniques of active meditations for the inner transformation of the modern man. His active meditations like Dynamic meditation, Kundalini meditation, Nadabrahma meditation are scientifically devised to consciously express and experience repressed feelings and emotions, and learn the knack of watching our habitual patterns in a new way.You can find out the science behind some of Osho meditations by clicking here

Osho's techniques give more freedom of expression. At our Meditation Studio , we dance, sing, relax, play, create, and celebrate life with the meditation techniques devised by Osho. And while we each can walk this journey of life, of meditation alone, it is more supportive ,more fun, more energetic and vibrant to share the process with others in a group.

Come share the cosmic dance....a dance where individual energies meet and unite with the cosmic energy !!!

For more information on osho meditations visit  below

http://www.osho.com/Main.cfm?Area=Meditation&Language=English

Listen 24/7 Osho Live at http://radio.osho.com , Iphone or Android Osho Apps available too.

For Osho News :-  http://www.oshonews.com

Other Popular Sites :-

http://www.oshoworld.com

http://www.tapoban.com/

results.description:
I have to be honest with you, I’m not the best networker. It requires an extraordinary amount of time and skill that I seem to never really have. I do, however, have a keen interest in a group where business owners can share their ideas, their triumphs, and failures if they like, so that others can learn and advise.

Most networking groups have people state what they do, over and over each meeting. If I’ve met you once, chances are I have an idea what it is you do. What I really want to know is what is the latest great thing you did for a client, what is the latest great client “Get” you made, what is the latest marketing strategy you are using that I could possibly try. Also, I want to know, as a business owner, what do you think of my business idea, my marketing idea, my strategy? These are the conversations I am interested in having. These are the conversations I think will yield better results for me and for all involved.

I’d like to start an informal group around this idea. I would also like to start the group with Female Hispanic Small Business Owners. The reason for this is simple familiarity. I am a part of an online community of female Hispanic bloggers and the generosity of spirit is tremendous. Additionally, if there is anything I can do, in even the most minuscule of ways, to help any Female Hispanic Small Business Owner would be great.

I’ll be holding the meetings in the morning hours, 8-9:30 am, in my office, twice a month.
results.name: The New York Female Hispanic Small Business Owner Meetup

Dances: Every Saturday morning
Time: 10am to noon
Location: Dance Theater Workshop, 219 West 19th Street, between 7th & 8th Aves., 3rd Floor, NY, NY 10011
Fee: $15 (full-time students with valid ID, $10)

5Rhythms founder Gabrielle Roth says: "Put your psyche in motion, and it will heal itself." This meditation practice can heal body and soul through expressive dance movement through five energies or beats: Flowing, Staccato, Chaos, Lyrical and Stillness.

Using music from around the world, this freestyle dance helps us navigate the constant change in our lives, express ourselves clearly and shed what we don’t need, so we live more consistently from a peaceful, yet free, place within us. It’s a workout for the body and spirit and can catalyze deep healing.

Open to everyone, regardless of age, size, gender or physical ability -- it is for those with bum knees or broken hearts! Wear exercise clothes you can sweat in and bring a bottle of water. We dance barefoot or in dance/jazz shoes. No chewing gum, socks, or perfume/oils/cologne on the dance floor.
