results.description:
[formerly New York Viral Media Meetup]

We're in the very early days of virtual reality adoption but, with companies releasing consumer VR headgear this year, and with the conversation surrounding how we are going to best use this game-changing technology heating up in the media, it is NOT too early for us to start talking about what we are all going to be doing (in some capacity or another) in the very near future (and some of us are working on this right now).

Some of the topics we'll be exploring in Virtual Reality Content Meetup include:

(1) Content trends in VR (who is pushing the envelope of this new technology with innovative storytelling that challenges our real world?) 

(2) What types of stories and experiences are best suited for VR and which platforms?

(3) How will brands help consumers adopt VR and be open to immersive VR experiences? 

(4) What will be the content marketers' role in the adoption of VR and how will it differ (if at all) from traditional media?

(5) Experimental content marketing models.

(6) User-generated VR (the next big thing?).

(7) What will happen when money pours into VR marketing -- how will media buys change over the next 2-5 years?

(8) Which brands are experimenting with VR content successfully and unsuccessfully?

(9) The latest research findings in VR (behavioral studies, how immersive VR changes our perception of the real world, unintended consequences of using the technology, etc.

I look forward to your feedback and suggestions. Feel free to reach out to me at charlie[at]servedfreshmedia.net. And do subscribe to my new virtual reality newsletter exploring how VR will change our perceptions of ourselves and the world around us. Sign up for the newsletter ("Glitch in the Matrix") here:  http://eepurl.com/bVFTgb

See you at our next Meetup!

Cheers,

Charlie Oliver
Served Fresh Media

results.description:
Welcome! <br>Long Beach Scrapbooking & Digital Photo Group was recognized by Starbucks Coffee as a group which "brings people together while making friends and memories" <br> <br>See the documentary they made about our meetup group. We were one of the few groups that was recognized worldwide <br> <br>meetme.starbucks.com/rebuildingmemories <br>https://www.youtube.c... <br> <br>At our meetups, our group gets together to work on albums, exchange ideas and try new techniques. <br> <br>Depending on the time of the year, we also meetup at Starbucks for coffee and scrapping. <br> <br>We are all about getting out of the house and getting together with other people who want to share their love of scrapbooking and craft making. <br> <br>We have two biannual crops "Croptoberfest" and "National Scrapbook Day" at LaQuinta Inn hotel in Garden City. <br> <br>We also have mini crops, classes and workshops throughout the year  Plus, attend many scrapbook events and fairs together as a group. <br> <br>We work on traditional scrapbooking albums and digital scrapbooking albums. But, our members love to  work on lots of other crafts at our crops. So, what ever project you are working on, bring it! We all love to learn and share anything crafty <br> <br>All levels are welcomed!  <br> <br>All beginners for traditional or digital scrapbooking, contact me if you are unsure what to bring with you to your first meetup. <br> <br>Many tools like the cricut, cuttlebug and punches are on hand at all events. New tools are introduced at crops and meetups when they come out via Creative Memories and Kiwi Lane (see my facebook page RecaptureU for new items) <br> <br>Also, check out my facebook  page scrapbook411 for scrapbooking, cardmaking and crafting industry news on national events, tools and contests <br> <br>Looking forward to meeting you and creating memories together <br> Jean'ette <br>

RSVPs required. NO soliciting please!
results.name: Long Beach Scrapbooking & Digital Photo Group

results.description:
The NYC Acoustic Guitar Forum is for people who aspire to learn to play the guitar.  Perhaps you've tried to learn on your own, or you've taken lessons in the past without success.  This group is for you!!!

There are many other groups in the NYC area where you can meet and network with other musicians, have sing-a-longs, and have jam sessions, etc. All of that is available in this group.  However, what makes this group unique is that rather than leaving learning up to chance, we intentionally focus is on high-quality lessons for Beginners, Intermediate and Advanced level players! As a member of this group, you will have the opportunity to learn and master the fundamentals of playing the guitar!  You will be much more effective at jam sessions, and in what you are able to actually accomplish as you participate in activities in the other groups you join!!  And yes, as you develop and expand your ability to play with groups and other musicians, you'll also have access to Jam Sessions, and be able to network with other members of this group.

Anyone at any skill level is welcome to join the group. The one primary rule for membership in this group is: you must have a profile photo that clearly shows your face.  If you are not recognizable from your profile picture, you will be removed from the group without further explanation.   Please click this link to Read BEFORE you Join!!

Bring your acoustic guitar to participate.  I have a limited number of instruments members can use if you prefer. And if you do not have an acoustic guitar, I can assist you in getting brand new, high quality, acoustic guitar of your own at a reasonable price.  Space is limited, so register for the workshop you wish to attend early. 

Get more info at these links:

• Workshops Offered

• Frequently Asked Questions
results.name: The NYC Acoustic Guitar Forum

results.description:
All across the globe, everyone is seeking new sources of energy. Meanwhile, the most transformative energy of all is hiding in plain sight. It's natural, sustainable, and infinitely renewable. It's called Inner Energy. And everyone already has it — including you.

Sahaja Meditation is a simple technique that lets you tap into that energy and harness its power to become better balanced and better connected to yourself — emotionally, physically, and spiritually. If you're having trouble juggling the challenges in your life, Sahaja Meditation can help you manage stress, master your emotions and find solutions to your problems. You'll enjoy better health, better focus, and a deeper understanding of the universe and your place in it.

Meditation is not just for mystics and monks. Sahaja is for regular people, too. Anyone can do it. It's that easy. But the Sahaja experience, you'll quickly realize, isn't your typical Meditations 'R Us class. It's much more than just feeling peaceful and relaxed. Sahaja Meditation has many layers, varied and deep. Explore at your own pace, in your own way. And our experts are always available to help.

Ready to plug into your inner energy? A Sahaja Meditation class is a great way to start. A few minutes of your life may be all it takes to connect to your inner energy and light the path to lifelong transformation. Sahaja is more than a temporary solution or quick relief— a journey, rather than a destination. It's all about energy — guaranteed pure and carbon neutral. You can never have too much of it. And with Sahaja Meditation, you can always make more.

The best part? All classes are free. No strings, no catch. There's nothing to buy, now or ever. And everyone is welcome. Bring a friend, bring your kids — we welcome all ages. After all, who couldn't use a little more energy?

For more, visit www.sahajameditation.com. Sahaja Meditation is a not-for-profit offering free spiritual meditation guidance in more than 75 countries worldwide.

results.description:
The Interracial Dating Group is for single people who are interested in dating other single people outside of their race.

As much as NYC is filled with so many different races and ethnicities, many of us tend to stay within our own circles which often makes it difficult to meet and date people outside our comfort zone. Now here's a group to bring single people of different races together to get to know each other, mix it up and possibly date or at the very least make a new friend.

However, in order to join and remain a member of the group ALL members nust adhere to a few rules:

Since this is a dating group ask all members MUST post a picture of themselves within their profiles. Let's fact it when it comes to dating looks do count, so please take a minute or two to post a picture of yourself within your profile and let other members see a face behind the words.

We also ask ALL members to please take a few minutes to fill out our Member Questionnaire, this is an important way for you to introduce yourself, tell us about some of your interests and let everyone know what you're looking for, whether it's casual dating, a possible relationship or just friendship.

Also, since YOU are the most important part of our success, we ask ALL Interracial Dating Group members to do the best they can to ATTEND our meetups.

Yes, we all have lives to lead and jobs to make sure the lights stay on, but what's the point in joining a group if you're not going to participate? This doesn't mean that you have to attend all of our meetups (of course you can if you'd like that'd be great!), but since we now meet every couple of weeks (sometimes MORE!), we ask that you try to make it to at least a quarter of our meetups (that's one every couple of months), that seems fair. Remember there are single people out there who want to meet you so come out to one of our meetups and join the fun.

We ask too that all members try to arrive on time to our meetups (which usually last a couple of hours at least) and if there any problems with the group or other members please feel free to contact whoever is hosting that meetup (or myself) and let them know (granted we're all adults and shouldn't need babysitters, but sometimes stuff happens).

Lastly, there is a small $12/annual fee to join this meetup group--in order words, only a dollar a month to take part in our monthly meetups as well as other social gatherings and meet other singles who are interested in dating outside their race, in person!

Once you've joined the group always feel free share ideas, give us feedback, let us know how we're doing and rate our meetups, we want your feedback so we can make the group the best that it can be.

Thanks,

Cleon
results.name: Interracial Dating Group

New York Italians is a501c3 non-profit organization, recognized by the State of NY as a PUBLIC CHARITY FOUNDATION, dedicated to preserving, promoting and celebrating the rich culture and heritage of Italy and its people through outstanding cultural events and culinary programs, language classes, educational lectures and charities.

In establishing closer cultural relations between the United States and Italy, we pledge to create a stronger face-to-face community to preserve Italian heritage and strengthen the common thread between the Italian and Italian-American populations.

The New York Italians Mission includes:

  • Encouraging the study of Italian language and culture in America
  • Preserving Italian and Italian American traditions, culture, history
  • Promoting closer cultural relations between the United States and Italy
  • Educational programs and scholarships
  • Grants for cultural preservation and advancement
  • Engage the community in innovative programs and advocacy issues
  • Cultivate partnerships with academia
  • Medical research
  • Disaster relief
  • Other Special Projects

New York Italians is organized for the purpose of providing a benefit to society as a whole, developing opportunities for our members, advancing US – Italy business, offering internships for younger members and networking events for professionals.

We are committed to honor those that came before us by ensuring that their love and enthusiasm for our culture is passed to our children and all future generations.

 

Visit us at http://www.newyorkitalians.org/

results.description:
What is our Great Books Reading Discussion Group and how do we work?

First we use the methods and texts from the Great Books Foundation. Our method is called Shared Inquiry and all texts for 2015-2016 season are from the second series of the Great Books Reading and Discussion Program.  (You can buy the set of paperbacks and the discussion guide from Great Books.)  Purchasing the texts is a prerequisite for joining the group and reading the text is a prerequisite for discussion.

For a list of the readings for the upcoming year look at the calendar or download the schedule under "More/Files", the menu item at the top of the page.

What is Shared Inquiry and how was it developed? Shared Inquiry was developed by Robert Maynard Hutchins and Mortimer Adler at the University of Chicago in 1947 to help discussion participants explore, interpret and evaluate the sometimes complex and challenging ideas in the great works we discuss. It is an intellectually rigorous activity that focuses on the interpretation of meaning within the written texts. It is Socratic in style and firmly text based.

In this process participants enjoy the benefits of diverse points of view focused exploration and common discovery.

Each Participant is engaged in an active search for the meaning of the selection at hand. With the energy and encouragement of the group, participants articulate ideas, support assertions with evidence from the text and grapple together with different possibilities of meaning.

How does it work?

There is a “leader” for each selection. The leader has read the text at least twice carefully and has developed interpretive questions—things that puzzled the reader (not questions with specific answers).

It is NOT a free-wheeling exchange of opinions and testimonials which go outside the text. Questions and discussions are always firmly grounded in the text itself.
Here are the basic guidelines:
1. Read the selection carefully before participating in the discussion. Take notes as you read.
2. Support your ideas with evidence from the text.
3. Discuss the ideas in the selection and try to understand them fully.
4. Listen carefully to other participants and respond to them directly.

What do you have to do to join?


1. To join the GreatBooks discussion, contact  Larry Schiff  917 749 0695, larry@larryschiff.com or Tamara Bedić  tamara_bedic@yahoo.com .
2. After clarifying with Larry or Tamara that you would like to discuss the readings based only on what is in the text of the reading, buy the texts from the Great Books Foundation ($28.95 plus shipping and tax) at Great Books.
3. Read the selection carefully as described above.
4. Come in and share (the first Wednesday of each month from 7:00-9:00 PM at the location that Larry or Tamara will send you in an email.) We charge a $5 fee for each meeting to pay for the cost of the room, if you are not a member of the Ethical Culture Society.

Check the calendar for exact readings and dates.

Many of our current members have been in our group for years. Some of their comments are listed in "Group Reviews" in the sidebar.

We look forward to meeting you and having you join our discussions.
results.name: Manhattan Great Books Reading and  Discussion Group

results.description:
Love Classic Rock? Who doesn't? Still, Meetup didn't have much of a Classic Rock presence, that is until now! Enter Classic Rock, NYC!

Do you hope you never hear N Sync's acapella version of, "More Than A Feeling?"

Do you think of The Eagles as a band, not just a football team?

Are you aware that Billy Idol wasn't the first one to do, "Mony Mony"?

Did you know that vinyl can be used for something other than seat covers?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then this group is for you!

My name is Andy Troy & during the 1980s I was the founder, drummer & songwriter of "The Shades", a popular power-pop band, based in NYC. Because of this, I feel that I'm the right one to bring Classic Rock to Meetup.com! Check out "The Shades" MySpace page: http://www.myspace.com/theshadespowerpop

Some of the events you'll be invited to include:

1) I host "The Andy Troy Show", a weekly radio show about interesting people & events in NYC that is heard from 8-9PM Mondays on The Centanni Broadcasting Network: http://centannibroadcasting.com/

We currently broadcast in front of a live audience out of Giovanna's, a restaurant on the Upper East Side.

Many well known Rock & Rollers have appeared on the show with more to follow. When I have guests that might interest the group I'll post the show as an event. Admission is FREE!

Previous guests have included:

 

*Tommy James (23 Gold Records!)

*Liberty DeVitto, drummer for Billy Joel for over 30 years. (3 appearences)

*Moogy Klingman, keyboard player for Todd Rundgren's Utopia.

*Ian Lloyd, lead singer for Stories. (3 appearences)

*John Ford, singer & guitarist for, "The Strawbs". (2 appearences)

*Kasim Sultan, bass player for Todd Rundgren's Utopia, Meatloaf & Alice Cooper.

*Peppy Castro (The Blues Magoos, Barnaby Bye, Balance)

*Sid Bernstein (The promoter who brought the Beatles & The stones to America!)

*May Pang (John Lennon's girlfriend)

*Spencer Drate & Judith Salavetz, authors of, "Five Hundred 45s: A Graphic History of the Seven-Inch Record"

 

Here is our Facebook group with links to past shows & pics of all our guests:
http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=284311799342&re...

2) I'm the organizer of the 3700+ member "The New York City Social Networking Meetup Group":
http://www.meetup.com/socialnetwork-6/

Many of our events feature bands, some of which will be well known Classic Rock performers. You will also be invited to those events!

3) I'm also open to your ideas so feel free to share them with me: AndyfTroy@aol.com

I hope you enjoy the group!

results.description:
Mission of Community Service ~ Long Island

Assisting members/potential volunteers with finding their volunteer potential while supporting various charities and causes throughout Long Island, NY

·         to bring as many members/potential volunteers together in a variety of ways for a variety of reasons -  anyone who has a desire to take an active role in a world bigger than them is more than welcome to do so

·         to come together to do a variety of good deeds through various types of events and for varied causes

·         to give back to as many causes/charities in the Long Island, NY community as much as possible

·         to connect with varied organizations and bring them to members/potential volunteers awareness for additional volunteer opportunities

The emphasis of this group is on its members/potential volunteers.

It aims to assist members in achieving their goals

·         to get an understanding of their personal reason/s for joining this group

·         to get an understanding of specific causes they are interested in

·         to get an understanding of how they are willing wanting and able to participate in giving back to the community

·         to get an understanding of their life style which might affect their participation in the group

·         to assist them through a variety of means for them to be able to make the most and get the most out of being a part of this group as is possible

By investing this time in our members/potential volunteers we hope that this group will have the enormous impact in supporting the Long Island, NY community that we are striving for.

Membership Fee:  None at the moment


Participation Rule (grounds for removal):

1) Failure to visit the group site after 1 year
2) Misconduct 

Rewards Program:

Suspended at the moment.


Message to charitable organizations:

Please DO NOT join this group unless you plan to volunteer for various events yourself.

This group is NOT for organizations to advertise and recruit, it is for the volunteers.

I can provide other ways to bring attention to your organization though:

*sponsoring the group through www.meetup.com - specifying our particular group

- cost of sponsorship

- http://help.meetup.com/customer/portal/articles/864989-costs-for-the-perks-program

- how to sponsor the group

- http://help.meetup.com/customer/portal/articles/615408-how-to-sponsor-meetups

*inviting us to participate in a planned event as volunteers

*inviting us to attend a planned event

*providing us with opportunities for group events we can do for your organizations

*sending a list of volunteer needs that I can forward to the members on your behalf

*assisting the Organizers with creating a packet that can be scanned and posted on the group site that represents and introduces our members to your organization in a pressure free way (We would meet you in person to work this through).

Please set these up through the Organizers, through e-mail and/or in meeting with them in person.... except for projects members create and wish to organize and lead on their own then they will get in touch with you and you would be working directly with them.
results.name: Community Service - Long Island

results.description: The Young Jamaican Professionals Meetup (YJP) is looking to bring together like-minded individuals who have interests in the betterment of Jamaicans in the Diaspora as well as back home.  We will operate under the guidance and tutelage of the Jamaica Progressive League (the League); the League was founded in 1936 to improve the quality of life for all Jamaicans.  The League, which is headquartered in the Bronx, has continued to be a crucial component in the quest for positive immigration reform in the United States and nation building back in Jamaica. They’ve realized they must do all they can to groom the next generation to continue the struggle and hence the YJP was created.  The YJP will provide a forum to discuss the many issues affecting the Jamaican community here and at large.  It will be a place to share fresh new ideas and network with other professionals with a common goal.   Topics that the YJP will like to contribute to include immigration, politics, as well as dispel the negative stereotypes associated with Jamaicans.  This group won’t be all seriousness and politics; we will also have fun experiencing all the rich Jamaican arts and culture that is abundant in New York City.
results.name: Young Jamaican Professionals of NYC

results.description:
NewJerseyR

NewJerseyR will be a free informal event, held quarterly and intended to serve as a platform for all local (and regional) R users to present and exchange their experiences and ideas around the usage of R.

A typical meeting will consist of 3-4 talks of about 20-25 min to give plenty of room for sharing your R experiences, discussions and exchange of ideas.

What is R?

R is a language and environment for statistical computing and graphics. It is a GNU project which is similar to the S language and environment which was developed at Bell Laboratories (formerly AT&T, now Lucent Technologies) by John Chambers and colleagues. R can be considered as a different implementation of S. There are some important differences, but much code written for S runs unaltered under R.

R provides a wide variety of statistical (linear and nonlinear modelling, classical statistical tests, time-series analysis, classification, clustering, ...) and graphical techniques, and is highly extensible. The S language is often the vehicle of choice for research in statistical methodology, and R provides an Open Source route to participation in that activity.

One of R's strengths is the ease with which well-designed publication-quality plots can be produced, including mathematical symbols and formulae where needed. Great care has been taken over the defaults for the minor design choices in graphics, but the user retains full control.

R is available as Free Software under the terms of the Free Software Foundation's GNU General Public License in source code form. It compiles and runs on a wide variety of UNIX platforms and similar systems (including FreeBSD and Linux), Windows and MacOS.

This information and more can be found at http://www.r-project.org/
results.name: NewJerseyR

results.description:
SEAS is a group of friendly Sailors.  We are here to teach you how to sail and to match Boat Owners with Crew.  If you want to learn sail or are experienced this an opportunity for you to get out on the water.

We have dock parties in the Spring and Fall.  Great food and a great sail.  We have been together over twenty five years.

The club owns and sails a 19' O'day Sloop on Greenwood Lake and a 27' Catalina Sloop on the Hudson River in Haverstraw. We have an open sail on most Wednesday nights for our dues paying members.  Our members sail the O'Day and Catalina the rest of the week by reservation. Once completing Basic Sailing Class you can advance in membership and learn Keelboat Handling on the Catalina 27.  Haverstraw is above Nyack and is the widest section of the Hudson River (three and one half miles wide).

Our Class includes four evenings of classroom instruction and two days of sailing instruction on the water to practice what you have learned.  All instructors are Red Cross Certified. Lesson fees are very reasonable.

Come check us out at a monthly meeting in North Jersey.


Ed Marcus

Commodore (Retired)
results.name: SEAS Bergen County Sailing Meetup

results.description:
This meetup was established with the hope of recruiting new members to join our core group of football players. As a group we have been playing regularly for the past few years. But as time goes by we've lost more members than have joined due to family, jobs, life, etc.

Our member's love of the game and sportsmanship remain. We play a competitive but relaxed game. We welcome new members and integrate them into football extremely well due to our relaxed nature. We teach and encourage members and treat them with respect. That means not degrading ppl for dropping passes, failing to run routes, etc. Everyone's a newbie at some time and we appreciate that ppl are willing to come out and spend their time with us. This is, after all, a game for FUN!

A new member noted to me "Wow it's great that it's competitive yet fun. I was in other groups whereby people would scream and yell at one another which made the games less than fun." We have guidelines established that resolves conflicts, disagreements quickly. We will kick off any person who is belligerent or degrades others. Fortunately we haven't had to come across this thus far.

As I noted we do play regularly. Ever since we joined meetup we've had many new members. We play pretty much every Sunday at 9AM and we usually have enough people for a full game. We try to get two separate games going at once when we can get 20 people. At our current pace that shouldn't be a problem at all.

We play two hand touch football. We normally play 6 on 6, just QB and receivers. We don't do linemen, kickoffs, flag football, running plays as to reduce injury risks. We've played these previously and tailored our current game to increase the fun and decrease the risks. Games are played until someone scores up to 7 points. If we have two separate games going the winner of each game plays the other to add in a little variety.

For those that don't have a car then please contact our leadership team. We can likely pick you up from a nearby train station. After the first game we can try to get another member to share a ride.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a fun game with competitive but relaxed people then come to our game. You'll have so much exercise your muscles will hurt the first week but you'll be wanting more afterwards!
results.name: NYC/Brooklyn Touch/Flag Football

results.description:
The networking group that gives you so much more!


NY Connect and Grow Business Networking group is the only group of its kind on Meetup because it allows you to leverage four powerful business tools:

  1. Personal Relationships

    Your net worth is determined by your network! Our facilitated networking events provide a perfect opportunity to form and nurture lasting relationships. We also teach you how to become an effective networker.

  2. Business Education

    Each event features a mini-workshop that focuses on principles you can use to grow your business.

  3. Mastermind Support

    Interact with fellow business owners to find solutions to the challenges you face. Sometimes all it takes is a fresh perspective to solve a problem!

  4. Marketing Platform

    Get a chance to promote your business both in the events through spotlight presentations and on our website (www.BizKriti.com).

Become a power networker
As a business owner or entrepreneur, are you serious about using networking to grow your businesses? Networking matters whether you want new customers, repeat business, referrals or attention of potential investors. However, it is seldom taught anywhere and consequently most networkers fail to get adequate return out of their investment in business networking meetings.

Business networking is not about exchanging cards! There are tools such as elevator pitches, one-on-ones, strategic alliances, follow ups and social media that you need to master. Whether you are a pro or a newbie, our tools help you tremendously in honing your business networking skills. Our events are quality events that help you grow into a power networker who gets real business out of networking meetings. We also strive to create a synergistic referral network for you.

Business education
Knowledge is a business owner’s biggest asset. Our workshops give you practical tools to help you maintain an edge in the highly competitive world of business.

  • Do you know how to set business objectives?
  • How often do you do strategic planning?
  • Would you like to master sales skills?

Dedicated business workshops cost hundreds of dollars and most small business owners do not have the time and money to take advantage of them. That is why our events feature condensed workshops that focus on just one aspect of business. What is more, you get to mastermind as you interact with fellow business owners to find out how the information applies to your business!

Our events
- Mingle with like minded individuals and create strong business relationships.
- Reach everyone in the meetup through elevator pitches.
- Take part in our highly successful interactive educational programs.
- Learn more about the mindset and skills of business ownership.
- Create strategic alliances.
- Become a spotlight speaker and promote your business.

Looking forward to helping you expand your business through referrals and education. Let's make networking work.

Keep learning, keep growing!
Aditi Gautam

Please note: To diversify our group, we are closed for following professionals now:

-Life and Health insurance

-Network marketing
results.name: NY Connect and Grow Business Networking

results.description:
GENERAL INFORMATION:

Long Island Co-Ed Soccer Club is the area's first and most well established adult co-ed soccer meetup group.  The Club was founded in 2010 and has grown from a small group to a powerhouse organization with multiple weekly games for men and women who enjoy playing friendly pick-up soccer.  Long Island Co-Ed Soccer offers all of its members the opportunity to play indoor and outdoor soccer in a fun and supportive environment where getting a good workout and making friends is everyone's top priority.  We frequently host other events outside of soccer, host parties, watch matches and attend soccer games together. 

Our games are played in Elmont, Floral Park, West Hempstead and at the Hofstra bubble depending on the time of year and the day of the week. Our outdoor games permitted full-field matches with large goals but we sometimes have small sided games with Puggs.  Our indoor venues offer large and small-sided games. 

We also host intra-Club tournaments about 4-6 times a year.  These tournaments have become epic events within the Club where the winners are awarded medals and bragging rights.  From time to time, we will put together special teams for scrimmages against other Clubs or other area tournaments. 

Our spots open to all members each week on Monday nights at 8:30 pm SHARP.  As the area's best Club, all of our games fill up quickly, especially during the spring, summer and fall and GAMES ARE NEVER CANCELLED for lack of participation.  RSVP is on a first come first serve basis and teams are sent out the night before the game between 8 and 9 pm.  You may RSVP for as many games each week as you want.  The Club has one golden rule - If you RSVP for the game, you must show up for your spot on time. If you change your mind about a game, you must change your RSVP no lather than 8:00 pm the night before the match (or 4pm for weeknight games) so that another member from the wait list can take your spot.  If your name is on the team breakout list, you must show up.   

Please, don't take a spot and not show up as your team relies on your attendance!! If you do this after receiving a warning, you are barred from RSVPing for a month and lose a spot in the next tournament.  If you do it after a suspension, your name will be removed from our list and you will not be able to play with us anymore.  The RSVP rules are enforced and they keep this Club running smoothly. 

In case of bad weather, check the site before you head out, in case of cancellation because of heavy rain or snow.  We try to call the games about 1 hour before the posted start time.


THE LATEST SPRING 2016 INFORMATION:
At the present time, here are you weekly options:

(1) Tuesday Night:

 Outdoor at Dutch Broadway:  6:30 PM, Full Field $3, hosted by Kyle

  Indoor at Storm Sports Academy, West Hempstead, 9:00 PM, $8, Kyle and Pete.

(2) Wednesday Night 

Indoor at Storm Sports Acadamy, West Hempstead, 9:00 PM, $10, hosted by Manny and Dennis

(3) Thursday Night 

Outdoor at Dutch Broadway:  6:30 PM, Full Field $3, hosted by DEnnis

Indoor at Storm Sports Academy, West Hempstead, 9:00 PM, $10, Tara.

(4) Friday Night - 10:30 pm,  Hofstra Bubble, Hosted by Dennis and Manny $15.

(2) Saturday morning at 9:00am, Dutch Broadway Park, Elmont, $3 Hosted by Dawn

(3) Sunday morning at 9:00 am Dutch Broadway Park, Elmont, $3 Hosted by Tara and Julio

Sunday Game 1 - Tara/Julio

Sunday Game 2 - Julio/Tara

Rules of Play:

Please note that all of our events are friendly events where slide talking, aggressive play and abusive language are not tolerated.  Any member who engages in this kind of misconduct will have their membership revoked.   We have in fact removed people because of their behavior.  Please also understand that soccer is a contact sport and that while we do our best to make it a fun game, you are assuming the risk of sustaining a serious injury when you play in one of our games.

Offsides Rule:

Since we don't have referees, we enforce offsides on an honor system.  Players are expected to always play fairly and this includes playing onside at all times.  If, however, you notice that someone is offside, you may call that player offside.  To enforce this rule, we ask defenders and keepers to be mindful of the rule and to try to politely enforce the rule at all times. Most players respect the calls.  If there is someone posing a particular problem, please notify your organizer and they will resolve if offline at a later time.

Penalty Kicks are always indirect kicks except for tournaments.
results.name: Long Island Co-Ed Soccer Club

results.description:
Dating With Dignity is a community of like-minded cool people who want to FIND LOVE and RELATIONSHIP in 2010! Our members are tired of hoping that Mr. or Miss Right will just magically appear one day at Starbucks, the gym or on Match.com and are ready to take ACTION to create change in their lives. They want to stop wasting time with flakes, end the frustration and loneliness that comes from dating men and women who don't meet their needs, and want to learn how to love themselves in the process!

This meetup is open to single women and men of all ages to help them identify and understand their destructive dating patterns, how to change their self concept to attract relationship-minded men and women, and thereby get the love they deserve. Our meetups include live workshops, ongoing classes, telephone classes and much, much more. Want to learn more? Check out our website, datingwithdignity.com for daily dating advice, cool video blogs, free tips and information on all our events! Lastly, our philosophy incorporates how to build self-awareness, tap into your authentic self, and take responsibility for your thoughts, feelings and actions in order to date with dignity.
results.name: Dating With Dignity

results.description:
Please join us in our photography workshop: The Art of Intuitive Photography! Each class will be held in an exciting location, and is offered as a 2 hour session, a day trip, or a 3 and 5 day workshop.

The Art of Intuitive Photography is focused on enhancing your intuition in photography, learning how to see differently, and compositional improvement. It is open to all photography levels and all digital cameras (including point and shoot). This is not a technical class, however we will go over basics to those who request/need it.

We will conduct exercises to tune you into your intuition, and learn how to take photos by following it. In addition, we will focus on the differences between looking, observing and seeing. Throughout the class we will give feedback on how to better the composition of your photos. You will notice that by the end of the class you will not only be looking at the world differently, but you will have better photographs to prove it!
Hope to see you soon!

Mindy, Lourdes and Sepia

www.artofintuitivephotography.com

www.mindyveissid.com
results.name: The Art of Intuitive Photography

results.description:
Seems like there's a ton of cool young LGBT folks in Central Brooklyn, but we always have to commute to the city or Williamsburg to meet each other. But central brooklyn - Park Slope, Boerum Hill, Fort Greene, Clinton Hill, Prospect Heights, Flatbush - has its own vibe, and some really great places to hang out, and Park Slope is the center of it all. So, why not hang out with each other here?

This group is not for random hookups or anything like that - just a bunch of LGBT folks getting together and hanging out, making friends. If something more comes of it, great! However, the group isn't here for people to just randomly hookup.

[Also, while I don't want to be the 'age police' or 'card' anyone (I think the 'honor system' works much better), I do think its kinda important that we try to keep this mostly for folks who are in their 20's and 30's, cause sometimes older guys can seem intimidating to younger ones, especially for those just coming out. And I think its important to allow a group for younger folks to serve the needs of that age group. But I recommend starting your own group then, the more the better!]
results.name: Central Bklyn LGBT 20-30's Meetup

**********************************************************************************

MEMBERSHIP POLICY

1) This group is for members of 18 years and older. Many of our meetups contain discussions or anime that are rated "R" material.  Even if you are a parent and you feel that your child is mature enough to attend the group, he or she will not be allowed to participate. Do not try to join until you're 18 or older, otherwise you will be banned until you're old enough. ヽ(#ﾟДﾟ)ﾉ┌┛Σ(ノ´Д`)ノ


 2) After TWO consecutive no-shows*, the organizer will e-mail you concerning attendance. If the e-mail does not contain a deadline for any required action, a second e-mail will be sent with stated action required. If the action has not been done by the stated deadline, the organizer will remove you from the group.


There is an exception to meetup events with limited spots in that ONE no-show would immediately result in contact from the organizer.

*Note: "no-show" = an RSVP of "yes," but not attending the event


3) If you have a problem with any other member(s), let the organizer know. The organizer will handle the matter however he sees fit. Do NOT take it upon yourself to deal with the matter such as through event posts or the discussion board.

 

4) The organizer has the right to refuse any membership or ban any member for any reason, though this is a rare occurrence. General rule, don't be a jerk. Or you will be banned ヽ(#ﾟДﾟ)ﾉ┌┛Σ(ノ´Д`)ノ


5) Because we many of our meetups (especially the monthly meetup)are at our private homes, we reserve the right to know who we'll be letting in. Therefore, if you are going to be joining, please either have your real head-shot in your profile, or email the organizer with a link to a picture of your face. Failure to do so will delay or even keep your membership from being approved.

 

SUJLI SDIIDAA, QKY BLI PYBR KPP. QKY'UD TDUNLIDIAOQ SLIIDV.

results.description:
Shut Up and Write! Meetup is a venue for writers to work in the company of other writers on a regular basis. Writing, whether approached as a profession or as an avocation, is an isolating activity. We provide this forum, writing resources and meeting times as a method of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about ‘writing down the bones’ and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

Meetup Format
Making the time to write one hour per week is an empowering and ultimately rewarding experience but it needs to serve as the foundation of your daily discipline. If you RSVP that you are coming, then please arrive 10-15 minutes before the start of the Meetup. The facilitator will lead introductions and then the group will write for an hour. There will then be 15-30 minutes of social time to get to know each other and possibly discuss personal writing successes such as getting published or overcoming writing resistance in some small way. No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.

Writing is the only thing that, when I do it, I don't feel I should be doing something else.
Gloria Steinem
results.name: Shut Up & Write! NYC

topics.name: Parents of Gender Variant Transgender Children

results.description:
Proudly Sponsored by PFLAG NYC

Stepping Stones is a network of families embracing their children’s gender non-conformity in a kind and loving manner. 

We are transitioning to a Facebook group. Please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/SteppingStonesNYC/


Our support group focuses on providing a monthly meeting place for parents to connect with other families by sharing information and experiences. There are two groups; a parent’s discussion group which is sponsored by PFLAG NYC, and a children’s playgroup which is sponsored by the member families. Monthly meetings are private to protect our young children’s privacy. Meetings are open only to families that have already decided to accept and support their gender different children and only immediate family members are allowed to attend.

There is one Children's playgroups up to age 12 and the group is designed to let our kids have some fun and get exposure to other gender-variant kids. The discussions do not focus on issues regarding such topics as gender, feelings, or bullying. Instead, kids are given a safe environment to develop regular friendships through common activities, such as board games, painting, clay modeling, etc.

The parents group is designed to let parents share their experiences parenting gender non-conforming children. We sometimes have guest speakers--therapists, gender-variant adults, or camp counselors. On other occasions, we lead our own discussion on topics such as concerns about safety, frustrations about family members not "getting it", or our own second-guessing how we support our kids.

New parents who are still struggling to accept and support their children’s gender identity, but would like to talk and explore with another family, can contact us.
results.name: Stepping Stones

results.description:
This group is for people who have been diagnosed (or not) with a mood disorder, are depressed or bipolar, have OCD, anxiety, or are dealing with either recent diagnosis. It's also open to friends, family, and supporters who want to learn about living with a mood disorder and share personal experiences. Here is a good place to start seeking help, or discuss treatment and challenges dealing with diagnosis and living with a mood disoder.


Group discussion can bring tremendous insight into yourself and provide the tools to get through the week, day, month, year. This is NOT a group therapy, just a discussion between people who have been struggling who are looking for feedback, tips, and support while overcoming these incredibly complicated responses to life.


If you lost your job and are feeling hopeless, having relationship problems, are grieving about losing someone close, are feeling lost and sad and need someone to talk about it, are supporting, living with, or have been raised by someone with a mood disorder, and want some insight into dealing with your feelings, or just rant - this is a place for you to get the support and motivation you need, ask questions, and gather the strength to deal with struggles of living with a mood disorder and the stigma from people many of us interact with on daily basis.



We have a resources page with useful information on getting treatment and learning about mental health

Please introduce yourself when you join, and tell me what you want to get out of this group.

topics.name: Accepting And Celebrating A Childfree Life

results.description:
Tired of losing good friends to the mommy or daddy track after they have kids and then drop off the face of the earth?  Tired of conversations over dinner and at parties being focused on the kids, schools, and  getting home in time to let the sitter go? Welcome to ChildFreeNYC -- the largest childfree BY CHOICE meetup group in the world. This group is not for parents and is not for people who wanted children but for whatever reason, cannot have them. It is for those who want to celebrate being childfree.

I started this group because the vast majority of my friends cannot relate to me on this important part of life: I've never had any interest in being a parent. Most of my friends and family, whom I love, are the opposite. And most do not understand my choice to forego children. Some think I'm selfish. Others take it personally that I have chosen something that is the opposite of what they've chosen. Meanwhile, I enjoy spending time with their children, but I'm always thrilled to go home and enjoy my childfree life. The problem is that most activities that are fun for me are not fun, or not practical for people with kids. Either they don't want to leave their kids home to go out and have fun, or they can't, because for whatever reason, the demands on their time or their lives prevent them from going out.

I do not divide the world into people with children & people without children. But I DO want to meet other adults who want to hang out in the city and enjoy what life here can offer to those of us who have more time, flexibility, and freedom (three of the best words in the English language as far as I'm concerned!)

As the news outlets & pundits talk about the childfree "movement," I just want to enjoy life without being "bingo'd" to death about my lack of interest in being a parent.  I'm exhausted from having to answer the questions about it.

Although there are other childfree meetup groups, all the others I've seen that are in New York City, or near New York City, are not in Manhattan. Several are only for singles or only for couples or only for people in a certain age group. So I started ChildfreeNYC to welcome ALL childfree people, regardless of age or marital status!  (We have lots of singles in this group, and lots of couples, and ALL are welcome, as long as you don't pull a lot of "no shows," meaning cancelling within 48 hours of an event. If you RSVP "yes" and then you cancel within 48 hours of an event, or you simply do not show up, you will be marked as a "no show." After 3 "no shows," you will be removed fro the group.

This is a strict policy, but in the many years of running this group, only a handful of people have been removed because most of our members are good about RSVP'ing accurately. So join us!  You can also visit us on Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/ChildfreeNYC
results.name: ChildfreeNYC

results.name: BroCon

results.description:
This group is an extension of my mission as the founder of Parent From The Heart.  It has been created to encourage like-minded, wholehearted moms and dads to gather for parent education and support through reflective dialogue, sharing helpful tips and tools along with personal challenges in a non-judgmental environment. We can meet for an "adult-only" discussion in the evening at a private home or public location. We can also gather at a "family-friendly" venue where child care is available in a well-supervised setting during the day.

My overall goal is to create an open, honest forum to promote awareness and mindfulness relevant to nurturing children of all ages with unconditional love, compassion and respect. I hope to inspire both men and women to develop a realistic vision for their family and gain the clarity and confidence needed for implementing this vision.  It does take a village to raise a family.  Growing together and evolving as a couple is a lifelong journey!  Let's recognize the raw feelings and inevitable conflicts as well as the joys and rewards of transitioning to parenthood. It's a life-changing and transformational event!

Over the past decade, I have extended and enhanced my career with additional training and professional development in the areas of family studies, social behavior, positive psychology, mindfulness and relationship counseling with specific attention to the transition to parenthood and it's effects on couples and marriage. Research has shown that there are concrete ways to prepare properly and positively for family life. This will, in turn, create a healthier and happier home environment in which to raise children.

Please share any questions, thoughts and suggestions.  Your feedback is essential to the success of this group!  I do offer FREE phone or Skype coaching sessions so that we can connect and get to know each other better.  Group support is terrific and productive on many levels.  Some may prefer working privately.     

Looking forward to meeting YOU soon!

Warmly, Erika
results.name: Building a Nest and Growing a Family

results.description:
If you want to live a more fulfilled life, first you will want to know your potential, who you really are. Meditation is the route to that knowing. It is the methodology of the science of awareness.

Many meditative techniques require one to sit still and silent. But for most of us accumulated stress in our bodymind makes that difficult. Before we can hope to access our inner powerhouse of consciousness, we need to let go of our tensions.

Osho Active Meditations have been scientifically designed by Osho over a period of time to enable us to consciously express and experience repressed feelings and emotions, and learn the knack of watching our habitual patterns in a new way.

At Meditation Studio we laugh, sing, dance, relax, play, create and celebrate life with the support of meditations designed by Osho. Osho has designed various techniques for the modern society that are therapeutic and enlightening. Osho meditations, books and discourses merge eastern and western philosophy and cover many topics including: zen, yoga, kundalni, dance, breathwork, chakras, Tantra, Buddha, Jesus, Zorba, Gurdjieff, Sufi-ism, and so much more.

Come join us for fun in the wonderful world of Osho.

"Osho is an enlightened master who is working with all possibilities to help humanity overcome a difficult phase in developing conscuiousness."  The Dalai Lama

results.description:
Welcome to the NY Mostly Go Club!

The "Mostly" is there since it's fun to do other things besides Go once in a while. For example, dinner or drinks after a tough tournament, a picnic with Go boards under blooming cherry trees in spring, whatever fun things we can think of.

We'd love to meet other people who are interested in the game of igo/weiqi/baduk in the NYC area.

 

Don't know how to play but saw it on some TV show or something and want to see what the game is about? We also host NYAMIGO Beginner's Workshops during our meetups, and everyone else is happy to teach beginners to play at any time.

More experienced players can come and relax over a game, maybe help other players improve. The goal is to have a fun atmosphere and make some friends.

 

For the moment, the primary meetups are the "Beginners Workshops w/ NYAMIGO" This doesn't mean stronger members aren't welcome, they absolutely are. It's just that the other NYAMIGO instructor, Naoki, and I will be spending more time teaching beginners than playing even games that day.

 

For the moment we don't have a regular meeting space, but am borrowing space at Meetup HQ once in a while. You'll have to see each individual meetup to check the location.

results.description:
Westchester Sail and Power Squadron ("WSPS") is part of the United States Power Squadron ("USPS"), the world's largest private, non-profit boating organization. Westchester was awarded its Charter in February, 1937. The majority of our members are drawn from Central and Southern Westchester County. The boating activities of our members take place primarily in the Long Island Sound and the Hudson River.

The Westchester Sail and Power Squadron (like all of the squadrons that comprise USPS) is made up of people who are interested in taking classes and seminars to learn about safe boating and who enjoy power boating and/or sailing.

If you are interested in learning about safe boating, we are the right group for you. We have multiple classes and we also have group activities throughout the year.

We also have Thursday night sail which is a lot of fun. We have several boats which go out on Thursday nights for sail from different marinas in Westchester.

If you would like to take part in our Thursday sail, you should:

1. Join WSPS MeetUp Group and become a member of the United States Power Squadrons. 1st year membership is $97 per individual and $133 for the entire family.

2. Send an email to John at jwsteger@gmail.com  at  least 3 days before the sail (Monday) so John can assign you to a boat.   If you can't get that information to John by Monday, he will try to accommodate you but may just ask you to be on the list for the following week.

3.  The email you send to John must provide a phone number where you can be reached.   

4.  Your friends will be accommodated only if there is enough room on a boat.  We will put a max of five people on a boat and that will include one experienced sailor to assist the captain.  So basically we will assign four passengers, one experienced member and the captain which makes 6 in total.
results.name: Westchester Sail and Power Squadron

results.description:
As many of you know, there are several different Chinese meetup groups in New York. At most of these meetups, speakers of all levels are welcome. This means that quite a large percentage of the conversation tends to be in English.

To learn and improve, it's necessary to immerse oneself and not to feel as if you can just switch to English anytime you want. I have started this meetup to create a place where intermediate, advanced, or native speakers can go and speak entirely in Chinese. Sure, you can translate a word or explain something complicated in English if necessary, but other than that, we're keeping it entirely in Mandarin.

You should join this group and come to this meetup if you can have a basic conversation in Mandarin, if you have lived or traveled in a Chinese-speaking country for some length of time, if you have studied Chinese in school or on your own for a while, or if you are a native speaker. Basically, you should be able to speak Chinese to some extent already if you show up here. The whole goal is to keep the role of English as absolutely minimal as possible when we meet.

That being said, if you are intermediate, don't be intimidated. I myself am hardly fluent, but if you have the basics down and want to improve your vocabulary and natural speaking, the best way to do it is to force yourself to use what you know and expose yourself to things you don't!

If you're not sure whether it is right for you, just ask.
results.name: Advanced Chinese Conversation

topics.name: Divorce Support for Women and Mothers

results.description:
You've survived a divorce... now you're concerned about making your settlement last

Most of the upheaval of your divorce is behind you, but your financial worries are growing. You know the amount of your divorce settlement; what you don't know is whether it will be enough to cover your day-to-day living expenses, pay for college and get you all the way through retirement. Will you outlive your assets? How can you ensure you can keep the assets you most treasure, rather than later selling them to survive?

These are just some of the questions that we'll address.

The focus of this group is about learning how to make your divorce settlement last as long as possible (through appropriate investments, budgeting & forecasting, lifestyle changes, etc.), so that you can secure your financial well-being, both now and for many years into the future.

We look forward to meeting you soon.
results.name: Divorced Women - Make Your Settlement Last

Join us if you are enthusiastic about learning and teaching about food, whether you are a novice cook wanting to shift away from processed foods or a gourmet natural foods chef. There are many different diets represented in our group, from GAPS and paleo, to vegan and raw.

Our Mission: "To Live, To Love, To Teach the Truth That Has Made Us Free"

Our Vision: "Awakening Humanity To It's Spiritual Magnificence"

results.description:
At Travel 2.0 we discuss and learn about travel innovations and technology, and attempt to help travel entrepreneurs and startups hone their vision and product.

The biggest and friendliest travel startup Meetup in New York, and now in San Francisco and Boston, we address travel in a web 2.0 and mobile context: Planning, search, booking, data, design, fundraising, marketing, monetizing, mobile tech.

We host travel startup founders to present their vision, discuss their stories, and share their lessons learned. Presentations are honest and interactive, with an audience Q&A.

We also host networking events to connect travel industry professionals and entrepreneurs, and educational events to bring the latest insight to our members.

Whether you're a travel startup founder, a travel industry veteran, or just want to know more about travel innovation and trends, Travel 2.0 is the place for you!

Travel 2.0 is supported by Travel Startups Incubator, which supports the travel startup ecosystem by investing $50,000 in the world's most talented travel entrepreneurs and early stage travel technology ideas.  ($25,000 USD cash + $25,000 worth of services)
results.name: Travel 2.0

results.description:
Hello Ladies!

Do you absolutely love going to fabulous events? Do you enjoy meeting new people, and making new friends? Do you love making a difference? If this sounds like you, then you have come to the right place!

This group is for young professional women, in their 20-30's, who are confident, fun, and love being a woman (and all its perks! ;) ). You can be single or coupled, new to NY or born and raised here, but ultimately a chic chick that loves to have a good time!

What I want this group to be about are three things:

1. Going to great events, such as beautiful lounges/clubs, red carpet screenings, launch events, cocktail receptions/opening nights, cultural events, or any other event where we can See or Be Seen, mix, mingle, and network with those in all different industries. Basically, any occasion to get dolled up, and put on a cute outfit!

2. Establishing great friendships. I figure if we are like minded, totally normal females, we shouldn't have any trouble making some great connections. We can do that by doing brunch, happy hours, spa days, and anything else we feel like. This is our group, we can do what we want!

3. Getting involved in making a difference. I have this dying need to get involved in the community, raise money for charities, and just help out those in need. I would love to plan events for a specific cause, or work with other organizations to reach a goal. And ideally, maybe even start a NPO. The possibilities are endless!

If this is what you are looking for, I would absolutely love it if you joined this group. So if you like to See or be Seen, you might as well do so while making a difference!
results.name: 20-30's Women, See & Be Seen, making a Difference

results.description:
Welcome engineers and technologists in the New York area. Whether you are a hands on software engineer, quality engineer, or a person just interested in advanced technologies, you will enjoy these meetups. Hosted at Google's NYC offices, these talks will cover a variety of topics of strong interest to the NYC technology community. 

Topics will range across the spectrum of computer science and software engineering, including information retrieval, user interfaces, programming languages, and computer security. In particular, there will be a track devoted to best practices for quality engineering and automation / engineering productivity (e.g. automated testing, building testing frameworks, etc). There will also be talks on business topics that are highly relevant to software engineers (e.g. entrepreneurship, future of publishing, social capitalism, etc).

If you have recommendations for future topics, feedback for the events team or are interested in future events and jobs at Google, please fill out our interest form.

Past meetups are generally recorded - enjoy!
results.name: Google NYC Tech Talks

jQuery NYC is a group that is focused on jQuery, jQuery plugins, jQuery plugin authoring, and jQuery integration with other libraries, core JS, etc.  While we are physically located in New York City, we want to connect all jQuery communities worldwide.

We also have some groups that are our friends in that they collaborate with us in one way or another.  Here is the list, and I encourage you to visit them and join them if they fit your interests:

  • HardcoreJS - Organizer: Milan Adamovsky
  • New York City Web Development Community - Organizer: Milan Adamovsky

Services offered by jQNYC:

  • Training - individuals, startups, enterprise

results.description:
The Brooklyn Business Networking Group (BBNG) is a branch of The NYC Business Networking Group (NYCBNG).  We've been a leader in hosting NYC business events for over 3 years and we currently have over 8300 members. We're bring our events to your own back yard.
 



 

 




 

 

CLICK HERE TO WATCH VIDEO


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our members are NYC's most influential and successful business professionals and include entrepreneurs, business owners, small-medium business owners, startups...newbie and veteran.

Click to see a list of business industries our members come from. 


GROUP SPONSORS:

Over the last 3 years The NYCBNG has been proudly sponsored by the following companies: American Express, Microsoft, AT&T / Hewlett Packard, GE ecomagination Challenge, HP ProBook PC Powered by AMD,  Regus Business Suites, Constant Contact, NY Enterprise Report, Amazon & Delivering Happiness (Zappos),  Microsoft 7, NYC Business Solutions, NYC Business Express, Capital One Bank, Banco Popular, Wachovia Bank, New York Life, Kaufman Foundation of Entrepreneurship, Madison Square Garden, Kaplan Testprep. Contact us if you'd like to sponsor our group.


MEMBER BENEFITS: 

There are many benefits to being a member of our community. We provide our sponsors and our members the opportunity to be part of an dynamic business community and connect with outstanding business professionals.

We are creating a community of high quality people and businesses including entrepreneurs, business owners, small business owners, both newbie and veterans.

We focus on business relationships, getting to know other members and working together to encourage a successful outcome for everyone.

We attract members who are driven more by contributing to others, sharing products and expertise, and listening than by selling, taking and talking.

The network’s success should be judged by the amount of win/win business that is generated for everyone, by the added value that members gain from participating, and by the extent that people really look forward to attending live events.

 





Cheers, Ilana (a.k.a. The Queen Yenta of Business Matchmaking)











VIDEOS: Videos from our 3rd Anniversary Celebration Party http://bit.ly/93jqLi and http://bit.ly/dpa92l





TESTIMONIALS: See what our members are saying about us in their own words. Video Testimonials and Networking Testimonials at http://bit.ly/bdnead





CLIENT LIST: We provide private services to our business clients. Contact us if you'd like more information. You can find a list of past and present clients at http://bit.ly/bMbnP5

The continuous emergence of new technologies and products are constantly changing how businesses are being conducted. If you represent a fashion brand, e-commerce portal, boutique, fashion media outlet, or a related technology - Open Source Fashion is for YOU!

We organize events in multiple cities that make learning and collaborating enjoyable and light hearted.

We look forward to meeting, learning, and growing with everyone!

Whether it is sharing ideas, sharing referrals, networking, or just hanging out, we all thrive on the flow of ideas, people and relationships.

results.description:
New York Angels - one of the largest and oldest angel investment groups in the US, has set up this meetup site with the aim of spreading the knowhow and tools required for early stage investment processes in the state of NY and its surroundings. The education / workshops / seminars we will provide will come from the best sources in the industry and will be delivered at cost - to maximize the knowhow transfer. 

Target audiences include angels, entrepreneurs, very early stage VC's (i.e. - VC 2.0), members of academia, local and federal government employees and service providers focused on venture creation and management.

With topics such as term sheets, valuation, deal negotation, pursuit of M&A, board membership best practices and many more - we will aim to deliver quality knowhow and best practices to our early stage community several times a year.

Membership is free to qualified participants from our target audiences - and each meetup (get-together) will have a charge associated with it, to cover costs.

Avi Fogel, the organizer of this meetup group, is a serial entrepreneur and a member of both New York Angels and Launchpad Venture Group - a Boston angel group. Avi has led 4 startups, in which he saw 6 (!) exits - in networking, security and enterprise software.

We are actively seeking co-organizers to help steer this effort in the most effective way.
results.name: New York Angels Education Meetup

We organize fun events where you can meet new friends who share your passion for theatre. So come to one of our events, have a drink, win a prize, and get to know other theatre lovers like you. topics.name: Singles and Couples who Like to Travel

results.description:
Travel & photography - two great things that are meant for each other. If you love both, this is the place for you.

Travel the world and take great pictures. Come with us to visit beautiful and interesting places around the world and return home with gorgeous photos.

Many of our meet ups will include some form of photography instruction. So if you've invested in a nice camera and would love to use it better, this meet up is for you. We'll help you get that camera off of Auto! And why not learn about photography in great locations, experiencing international culture, beauty, food, wine and so much more. I partner with specialized travel companies who create custom trips that take us off of the beaten path and give us the best photo opportunities as well as unique experiences that you will not easily forget. The goal is to visit beautiful and interesting destinations, especially the places that tourists do not normally get to see.

Whether you love to travel solo, as a couple or in a group of friends, you are welcome to join us. Our trips will even be great if you travel with someone that is not necessarily into photography. They can still come along and enjoy the beautiful destination while you have a chance to improve your photos.

We are low-key but really passionate! 

Sound interesting? Sign up and join us on our next trip.

 

NOTE: Unauthorized solicitors will be automatically removed from the meet up group. Please contact the organizer if you would like to discuss sponsorship opportunities that might be appropriate for and of interest to this group.
results.name: Love to Travel - Photography Workshops - NYC

topics.name: New to Bodybuilding, Fitness, Figure Competition

results.description:
Welcome to Fit in the City...

8 of my friends and I all are bonded by our goals of being fit. Some of us want to lose weight, some  want to gain muscle - but all of us are striving for fitness. Since we are all separated through various parts of New York, we figured this central site would not only help us keep connected, but inspire our friends & family and create a larger network of fitness partners.  Some of our friends who are trainers, or work in fitness, will be weighing in with advice, recipes, motivation and more. Join us for some fun meetups that we are planning, and hopefully, for our success.

 

I'm Chris, the organizer of this. I was 410 pounds and lost 180 in about a year and a half. I have kept my weight off for about 10 years and now I am planning to do a fitness competition next year. Let us know what your story is, and I hope that all of us can reach our goals together.
results.name: Fit in the City

results.description:
"Wow! The New York Power Team is almost like TED Talks meets highly experiential learning and masterminding.  I was blown away by the quality of members who were up to BIG things. Thanks for putting such an amazing community together" - John V


The New York Power Team is the largest monthly meeting personal growth and leadership community in New York. We have been meeting since 1993, empowering members to lead inspiring, authentic and fulfilling lives. We are a fast growing group, filled with leaders and luminaries from every walk of life. We focus on growth and mastery in 6 core areas of life:

-------1) Business/Career/Financial
-------2) Relationships - Personal and Professional
-------3) Emotional Well Being
-------4) Intellectual/Mental/Learning
-------5) Health/Fitness/Healing
-------6) Spiritual/Contribution/Ethical


We welcome to our community Tony Robbins graduates and empowered guests from other communities including NLP (Neuro Linguistic Programming), Peak Potentials, Landmark Education, Rich Dad, Integrative Nutrition (IIN), Personal Dynamics, Jim Rohn, John Maxwell, Eckhart Tolle, Wayne Dyer, David Deida, Ken Wilber, Byron Katie, Brian Tracy, Oprah Winfrey, Stephen Covey, John Assaraf, Tim Ferriss and others.

The commonality here is simply that we are committed to personal and professional growth and improvement.  We are working together to share ideas that get results as simply and efficiently as possible!

POWER - (Personal Power) the velocity by which you manifest your goals and make them reality.

--------- T.E.A.M. - Together Everyone Achieves More

Share breakthrough strategies and empowerment skills at New York Power Team events. Forge life changing experiences and powerful networks. See and hear dynamic and engaging speakers present.


Invest in yourself and take charge of your life now! Have you in the past (maybe even the recent past) had challenges that you did not know how to overcome? Come meet an exciting, connected community that can help you develop the building blocks for creating excellence. Apply the Law of Proximity by connecting with other Success-Driven professionals at our monthly meetings.

Grow!
Connect!
Thrive!



Come join the New York Power Team conversation stream on Facebook

http://www.facebook.com/groups/NYPowerteam/


You can also sign up to our mailing list by clicking here: http://eepurl.com/j8DXH


"One of the greatest expectations on who we are becoming, is the expectations of our
peer group."
~Tony Robbins

"When two or more people coordinate in a spirit of harmony and work toward a
definite objective or purpose, they place themselves in position, through the
alliance, to absorb power directly from the great storehouse of the creative
mechanism of each contributing mind."
~ Napoleon Hill, Think And Grow Rich


"Environment is stronger than will power... Be always with people who inspire you;
surround yourself with people who lift you up."
~ Yogananda, Autobiography of a Yogi

"You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best
develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment.
Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?"
~ W. Clement Stone

Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
~ Mark Twain

"80 percent of success is just showing up"
~ Woody Allen

"Power is the ability to do good things for others."
~ Brooke Astor, philanthropist
results.name: New York Power Team

results.description:
The Real Estate industry is hotter than ever, and there are unlimited opportunities to make cash from foreclosures, short sales, auctions, flips, REO’s, rehabs, multi-family dwellings, and so much more! Real Estate has always been one of the best industries to work in to create limitless wealth and long-term prosperity. Join us and learn how!

Given the current, unique real estate climate, there’s no better time than right now to dive in, and start benefiting from the infinite opportunities in real estate.

If you have an interest in real estate, or are already working in real estate, this opportunity is for you! This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to change your financial future, increase your revenue, and improve your life! Beat the recession, and take advantage of this opportunity today!

We are a highly successful New York City Real Estate Investment Group in search of dynamic, assertive, ambitious, driven, and self-motivated individuals, who are interested in building wealth and prosperity in a fast-paced and financially-rewarding business environment.

At our meet up, you will be introduced to individuals who are masters in the field of real estate. You will have the opportunity to learn how you can be a part of this bustling market! We have in-person meet ups, as well as virtual meet ups via webinar.

We do more than just teach you about real estate. We provide you with all of the training and tools you need to be successful as a real estate investor.

Our unique system in real estate investing is unparalleled, and is proven to provide success to
motivated and hard-working individuals. We provide you with all of the professional training, and revolutionary marketing tools necessary to begin to make money and get results quickly, in today’s Real Estate climate.

You will learn how to manage Real Estate investments for all types of properties including: foreclosures, short sales, rehabs, auctions, multi-family dwellings, flips, wholesales, and cash flow rentals.

No experience, background, or license in real estate is necessary. You only need to be a driven individual who is hard-working, and eager to learn.

We will train you on our proven techniques for success in today’s real estate market, and continue to empower and assist you in the future, to guarantee your continued growth and financial success.

This is an excellent opportunity for you to increase your income, and has the potential to create a six-figure income for you!

Limited spaces are available, so reserve your spot today.

results.description:
Peeps – yes, our Meetup Lingo has you down as CDi Peeps. Take it. Don’t argue.

This Meetup Group shall serve as a medium to announce and promote events hosted, organized or attended by CDi and its members. These may include concerts, exhibits, film screenings, field trips and panel discussions. Click here for a selection of past events.

Post by bwè kafe.

Short Video Capturing the Energy of our most recent Benefit Concert

Our primary goal for this group is to connect you with the issues we care about. The issues that drive us and that we spend so much time working on. If we can inspire you, if we can share our vision with you, we succeed.

While we used to host a regular recurring Meetup for our members, we have decided to do away with this fixed monthly date. Instead, we hope that you will enjoy the events CDi and our friends and partners share here with you.

Particularly, we hope that this revamped group and format will encourage listings of and participation in bicycle rides in and around the City. You may know that, amongst others, we have a program called Miles of Trees (MoT). MoT is an athletic fund raising initiative for reforestation and tree nursery projects (in Haiti and beyond).

In the three years since Miles of Trees was launched, we have steadily grown, heavily pedaled, and significantly celebrated the rush and adrenaline that comes with physical exercise and the outdoors.

Now, we want to take the next step and really open up Miles of Trees to everyone, novice or expert rider. Previous MoT riders, current team members, and members of the MoT Organizing Committee will be using this group to post fun, training and practice rides.

These rides will vary in length, in time, and in difficulty. There will be rides for all of you. We hope you will enjoy this as much as we do and join us for not just a ride or two, but for a season and a cause. The 2014 season will have as its highlight our fourth annual Miles of Trees Flagship Ride from Virginia Beach to NYC – 4 days, 360 miles. You can do it!


Please explore our "Pages" in the top menu bar to learn more about CDi and this group.
results.name: CDi - Community Development International | Miles of Trees
